This is not your typical Italian restaurant - as it has some middle European flare.  We finished our night with fresh delicious biscotti.

The waiter was kind enough to take us to the kitchen to meet the chef and his wife - such pleasant and unassuming people.  It is obvious they pride themselves on what they serve. 

A great find!
author: Alfredo V.

description: We hosted a small celebration in honor of our wedding and soon-to-be follow-up wedding in the Istrian part of Croatia at Albona back in April. The team went above and beyond to make our menu fantastic for our guests to enjoy and was so lovely throughout the whole evening caring for us. The food was truly phenomenal and the ambiance was perfect and intimate. I've dined here several times before and will always come back. Albona has a special place in San Francisco as the one and only Istrian restaurant. All should come and enjoy.
author: Una H.

description: Service was TERRIBLE!!   I have had better service at a fast food drive through.  Only reason for 2 stars is because the food was decent.... not great though, especially given the price. Wait staff made us feel like we were a total inconvenience from the moment we walked in. We were only one of a half dozen tables with patrons, so it was not because they were busy. Very disappointing.
author: Jeanne A.

description: If you want to try Istrian food, this is the place to try!!! Great food and friendly efficient staff.
author: Roberto R.

description: Honestly the food was okay. My Friend and I found them on yelp and have been wanting ton try it! The place is pretty and the staff was very nice and helpful! But for Italian I honestly had better.. My pasta tasted like chef boyardi.. And my fiancés dish had lemon chicken with cares and was too salty.. Their lamb had great presentation and was good but honestly they pasta I got was really just okay! The ambiance though was nice I really like the feel of a romantic small restaurant . But for taste.. I'm not big fan..
author: Gloria M.

description:
The service was lovely!
The dishes were incredibly delicious!
The prices are a little bit too high but it's worth it.
author: Itay G.

description:
Delicious asparagus soup (made with chicken stock - no cream or butter!) and the chef was kind enough to grill my salmon with no butter :)

The wait staff is attentive and pleasant.

It's a SUPER small place - seats only 42 - so very intimate :)
author: Cat B.

description: The BEST panna cotta I have ever had!!  Served with a port wine and wild berry coulis.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Great experience! Had the Strudel and the mushroom risotto for entrees and they were delicious. Highly recommend this place. Had the mussels for appetizer and they were very good. The sauce was awesome. Wish I would have gotten the mushroom soup but I was too full.

The only negative is there is a group of thugs that hang out a block away. When we Walked to the restaurant it was still daylight and there was only 2 eyeing us. After dinner there were 6 of them standing in the street and we had to alter our route back to our hotel. So .....my advice would be to take an Uber or cab. I would have no trouble going back there to eat but you need to be vigilant walking around there at night.
author: Luke H.

description: Yummy!  In a city filled with good restaurants (at a great price) Albona's hits the sweet spot.  An intimate, spot - dining room seats maybe 45 - you almost feel like you're having dinner at Grandma's house - except Grandma can't cook that well.  Owner came out and introduced himself and the specials.  Food was fab and the wine selections perfect.  The service hit the perfect middle between helpful without looming over the table.  Had the appetizer course, dinner, wine and coffee and got out for under $60.  Will definitely come back when I'm in the city.
author: Robert H.

description:
Definitely 5 Stars!!!  This is coming from a first timer.

While DH and I were spending an overnight in SF he spotted this resto on Yelp and made a reservation.

It was a short hike from our hotel (Sheraton).  Our reservation was at 5:15p and was greeted nicely by our server.  We decided on the Calamai al forno con salsa marinara (whole squid stuffed with shrimp) for appetizer.  It was completely different from the usual calamari we've had many times before.  It tasted fresh and delish!  For entree DH had the Stinco de videl a la Triestina (veal shank with polenta) and I had the Strudel con pasta fatta in casa (cannelloni with prosciutto and white sauce).  Both were to die for!  The meat on the veal was falling off the bone and the cannelloni were delicious (but wish the serving was a bit larger).  

While we were waiting for our meal to come out we noticed the owner/head chef greeting other guests and reciting the specials.  He walked past us several times and we felt a little ignored since we were the first one to arrive that night.  Later on he delivered our food and a few minutes later made sure we were doing okay.  He also helped clear out our dishes.  When we told him it was our first time and that we really enjoyed our meal he told us he's buying us dessert...gasp!  OMG!  How can we say no to that?  
For dessert we had the Tiramisu (moist and delicious) and Bonet (dark chocolate amaretto flan) it was different from any flan i've had before.  It isn't anything like a creme brulee..it is denser, creamier and "stick to your hips" type of thing.  It was worth every calories we ingested!

It was a wonderful dining experience from the servers to the head chef.

A definite must visit whenever we're in the city.
author: Cossette P.

description:
I've been here twice, and both times have been totally lovely experiences, with great food and memorable service.

As other reviews have mentioned, it's a pretty intimate dining environment. They accommodated our group of five quite well, but I think anything more than six would be pushing it.

On our second visit, we ordered a bottle of wine that they turned out to be out of--so our server came out with three similarly-priced alternatives and let us choose from among them. I think that was pretty cool. And we ended up with a really excellent wine, to boot.

This is now my go-to Nice Italian Restaurant in North Beach. A great place for a romantic date, or just to have a classy dinner with visitors from out of town.
author: Greg P.

description: This was probably the best Italian restaurant I have ever been in! The atmosphere of this cozy place was so lovely, and there was excellent service! The food is absolutely to die for!! I was in a big group, and the service was very impressive. The specials were fantastic, and the wine was also delicious. Many people in my group ordered the homemade lasagna. They said it was the best lasagna they ever had!   My father had the three cheese ravioli, and it had very interesting spices, such as nutmeg. The potions of the dinners were also perfect!The desserts were also fantastic. Tiramisu is definitely a recommendation!! But, the flan was not the best. That is really my only critique, but overall, I definitely recommend going here for a special, cozy Saturday night dinner!
author: Samantha R.

description:
Perennial favorite. Just go. Service is great and the owner (Samuel) is always around. He treats you like family, and ensures his staff take hospitality as seriously as he does. 

Just go. 55 bucks per person very well spent.
author: Ian T.

description:
Albona is such a gem hidden in the back of North Beach, just a block away from the touristic Fisherman's Wharf, located in a quiet residential neighborhood. 

Both my husband and I love Italian food, this is how we discovered Albona almost a year ago, upon a YELP search for top Italian restaurant in San Francisco. What did attract me there the very first time was the description about its intimate and family like setting, which I feel always hearty and missing about my days back in Europe. In addition, I'm very curious about what Istrian is really about. 

Albona meet and exceed all our imagination and expectation. We love every aspect of our dinning experience there. The environment is warm and cozy with soft music in the background. Service is stellar! The waiters are professional and friendly, very knowledgeable and make us feel comfortable and relaxed. Food is so fresh and delicious! And the portion is big! We tried the grandmother specialty of pan fried potato gnocchi, braised veal shank and Brodeto. We were so full that we didn't have more room for desert. 

It was such a memorable and pleasant experience that brought us back again last Wednesday. This time we ordered the Brodeto again, and tried the specially braised rabbit. We also enjoyed the stuffed squid and grandmother's specialty for appetizer, and finished with Tiramisu, coffee and tea. Again, we were full to divine. 

We can't wait to go back  and try out rest of the menu!
author: Christine W.

description: Really nice cozy place to have a romantic dinner! Everything was great , the food was delicious specially the filet mignon ! Definitely I recommend it !
author: Luisa L.

description: Albona is a San Francisco gem.  I live nearby and have been there many times.The dining room is small and intimate. One of the best steaks I've ever had was here, unfortunately steak is not always on the menu. Service is great and the prices are reasonable for such good quality food. I prefer Albona to any of the overpriced and overrated touristy Italian restaurants in North Beach. I'll be back !
author: david b.

description:
I half don't want to write this review so I can keep this a secret to myself (and the other 500 plus Yelpers.) I 25% want to continue writing because this may be the first review I haven't seen Cherylynn N. reviewed and I want to beat her to it. Please don't tell me I'm wrong! 

After a few back and forth with my friend about how to pronounce the (x-rated) name of this place and whether it was Austrian or Istrian cuisine (he taught me a thing or two, I had never heard of Istrian food), our group of 4 walked in a bit on the late side and then we were served one of my favorite meals in San Francisco. However, it was too romantic for a post-bar dinner. But we made do with a few bottles of champagne and wine.

The service and the food were unexpected and delicious. No, it's not revolutionary nor exactly modern, nor gastroyouknowwhat. Every dish that came out was great. I would recommend what dishes to order, but honestly, I don't think it matters. 

Just go! Guys, take your dates here, you will get laid after.
author: Kit E.

description:
Throwback Thursday.

Never quite got this: http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Throwback+Thursday

Definitely got this:

- Calamai: Surprisingly light yet flavorful squid stuffed with bread crumbs and spice mixed with marinara sauce.

- Peperonata: Rich mix of balsamic caramelized onions, eggplant, bell peppers and a few other assorted items.

- Taierini Misto de Mare: Generous and delicious plate featuring linguine and seafood tossed in a white wine sauce. 

- Arosto De Coniglio: Tasty half rabbit braised with honey, brown sugar, balsamic vinegar complemented by polenta cakes and baby carrots.

- Strudel De Pomi: Perfect balance of apple, cinnamon, pine nuts and raisons.

Linguine was probably my favorite but also loved the unique calamari combination, rare rabbit find and sweet strudel. Enjoyed them all.

Space and price were the throwbacks on this Thursday.

Former a retro fancy vibe where the polished staff, white tablecloths, classic soundtrack made for a subdued, almost serious mood. Could have used a refresh.

Latter was a reminder of earlier times when you could enjoy a great meal with a bottle of excellent red wine among four friends for $60/person. Totally worth it.

Four star Thursday meal.
author: Jason B.

description: Awesome! In for out of town and found this place on Yelp. Old school Italian fantastic?  Great service. The real deal!
author: Mark H.

description: What a fabulous little place.  My daughter had the rabbit, it was outstanding!  My lamb chops were great as well.  The service is great.  You can't go wrong with this restaurant.
author: M C.

description:
Amazing dinner, the mussels appetizer was just very flavorful, and I eat a lot of seafood, so I feel I'm pretty particular about that dish. The meal itself was exceptional (she had salmon, I had linguini with seafood). Both dishes were great.

And the service was top notch!

Definitely coming back!
author: Jason J.

description: The risotto was over cooked... Both mushroom & veggie risotto over cooked... The lamb & strudel was good... Service was good
author: Shahin N.

description: Awesome small little Italian restaurant!  We were craving some Italian food and the previous reviews on this place sounded good.  They didn't disappoint, very small place 11 tables total.  This is the perfect spot for a romantic dinner for two away from the busy streets.  I definite recommend if you're in the area.  Looks like a house in the neighborhood, luckily I saw the Zagat sticker on the door! Lol
author: Greg S.

description:
The meal was average minus. And for the price and after reading the reviews it was very disappointing. 
For the main course we ordered a fresh halibut and a mushroom risotto. 
The fish was served in a very unappetizing way and was mehh. 
The risotto was also below average.
For dessert we ordered the pana cota. Again, nothing to write home about. 
If this was street food that cost 8 dollars a portion this meal would have been ok. 
For a bill of 66$ before tip this was really disappointing.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Thank you Yelpers for helping me find this place. We were looking for a decent restaurant to eat at that was close to Cobbs Comedy Club. 

It's not a traditional spaghetti with meatballs and marinara/pizza Italian place, but an Istrian (northern Italy, Croatia & Slovenia), so some of food may seem unusual for an Italian restaurant.  It's a small restaurant, I recommend making reservations. It's a bit non-descript from the outside, and if you weren't looking for it, you could easily pass it by.

Parking in the North Beach area can be challenging. You can try your luck at street parking, just be sure to carefully read any restriction signs. I would just bite the bullet and pay for parking. The cheapest we found was a block up for $25.00. 

Overall experience was very satisfying, but not over the top. The wine reccomendations made the whole meal wonderful. Our entire bill came to a little over $100 with tip.
author: Andrea T.

description: I'd give 3.5 stars if I could because the service was good and the food wasn't terrible, just disappointing. I ordered the filet mignon. It came out overcooked and it was not tender in the way filet should be. If you told me it was sirloin, I'd believe you. The dish as a whole reminds me of the 90's, outdated and unoriginal.
author: Shelley S.

description:
The first thing I noticed walking into Albona at 5:45 on a Friday night was how quiet it was.  I liked that very much and was looking forward to a great meal.  

Then the waiter who doubles as the host asked if we had reservations.  We did not.  There were only two occupied tables, but waiter/host guy stood silently for a full 30 seconds, keeping us in suspense as he looked at a piece of paper.  Finally, he said he could seat us, but he was concerned about all the 7:00 reservations.  

He then sat us directly next to one of only two occupied tables in the place.  And the tables are very close together.  Seated directly next to me, less than a foot from my elbow, was a very obnoxious man who spoke non-stop about himself and how he knew so much about Italy because he had been there so many times.  He criticized each dish, made vulgar remarks to his dining companion, and bloviated about his superiority, making ridiculous comments about Naples, which is nowhere near the source of this restaurant's cuisine.  Then he decided to talk (and talk and talk) about tennis.  I don't know how he managed to eat anything.

Of course, it was not the fault of the restaurant that this man was a popinjay, but they must have noticed it by the time we walked in, and seating us right next to him, when all but one other table in the place was empty, was indeed their fault.

My friend and I shared the fried gnocchi appetizer.  Glorified tater tots.  I would have preferred plain gnocchi.  Then I had the veal shank and polenta, which was fine but nothing special.  The bread served with the meal looked like institutional rolls.

Meanwhile, I tried to ignore Mr. Ego, but he spoke as if he wanted everyone in the room to benefit from his wonderful life.  Perhaps he was overcompensating for his comb-over and the age difference between him and his dining partner.

There was no way I was going to have dessert, as I wanted to get away from the braying mule as soon as possible.  I paid cash so we wouldn't be there another minute waiting for my credit card to be processed.

For such a small place, it would have been nice to have interacted with one waiter throughout the night and learned a bit about the place.  Instead, host guy took our order, someone else brought it out, a third person cleared the table and oddly rearranged and then re-rearranged everything on the table, another person filled the water, and a girl we had never seen tried to take our dessert order. 

And when we left at 7:30, there was only one additional table in the place that was occupied!  

When we finally got outside, my friend and I busted up about the pompous boor at the next table and walked through North Beach.  Neither of us mentioned the food.

Be aware that this place is right across the street from a large housing project.
author: Bay G.

description:
The owner was very nice.  The service was good and the food was excellent.  We started with their Squid Stuffed which was tasty.  For our main course, we order the fish special (salmon) and Strudel con pasta fatta in casa.  Both dishes were delicious.   Ended the meal with Apple Strudel with vanilla ice cream.  

What a great way to the end the weekend!!   

We'll be back again real soon
author: Al G.

description:
More of a 4.5 rating than a 4.

We were the youngest bunch in the (small) restaurant and the servers made it obvious (they asked if we were 21 and over, twice, and if we wanted to have the bill separated ahead of time, haha). Regardless, everything else was amazing.

For me, I got the stuffed calamari with tomato sauce and OMG, it was absolutely delicious!! I ate everything, even the garnish because it was that good! I then moved on to the rack of lambs, cooked medium rare. OOOOH, so tender and juicy!!
The others ended up getting salmon, mushroom soup, and seafood pasta, which they said was really good also.

Service was very attentive. Refilled our water accordingly, checked on us, etc.

P.S. I'm craving me some of those calamari!!!!
author: Judy N.

description:
I had one of the best meals in my life here.  They don't have thousands of items on the menu. I started off with house salad and mushroom soup. The salad is so good. The dressing is just the right amount and not overpowering the taste of the veggie. The mushroom soup is the best I've ever had in my life.  It is so good that I run out if words to describe how good it is. 
My entree is chicken breast with mashed potato. The chicken breast is top with garlic lemon sauce and is very tender and juicy. 
I normally don't get dessert but the girl sitting next to my was having terimisu and it looked so good. It is indeed very good and I ate it in 1 minute.  
I just had a terrible dinner the night before so I really appreciate the wonderful meal here. The star rating really stand true for this place.
author: W C.

description:
I had been very much looking forward to Albona based on all the rave reviews on Yelp and from friends.  I bought a Bloomspot deal for a 4-course meal for two, and I finally had my chance when I made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday, but I found it to be... only ok.

We started with the pan fried gnocchi and stuffed calamari.  The pan fried gnocchi was buttery smooth and I liked the slight crunch on the outside.  I wasn't a fan of the brown butter spiced sauce that it came with, but I think that was a personal taste thing (read: I may not like cumin.. still trying to figure that out haha).  The stuffed calamari was good, and I liked the spiciness of the sauce. 

We had the strudel for a pasta dish.  This was good (what baked pasta isn't??) but simple.

The most disappointing part of the meal were the entrees.  We got the rabbit and the filet mignon.  The rabbit was presented whole* (kinda creepy but also kinda cool haha).  This was by far the least appetizing because it was so incredibly dry and hard to eat with all the tiny bones left inside.  The cabbage jam type thing on top was sweet and delicious, but I really wished the rabbit weren't so dry.  The filet was ok, but it was stringy and could've been juicier.

We ended with the bonet (dark chocolate/amaretto flan) and the tiramisu.  The bonet was the best dish of the night -- really rich and good.  The tiramisu was ok, but probably closer to the bottom of my ranking of tiramisus I've had in my life.

As for everything else, the place was cozy/small -- definitely more for intimate occasions, and the service though nice was somewhat slow.

Everything (except that one dessert) was lacking, so based on the food, I wouldn't be back.  I guess I'll have to keep searching for other good restaurants for nice occasions!

* I guess it was only half the rabbit, but it looked whole!
author: Alice M.

description: This is one of the best restaurants in San Fran. I love the stuffed pork loin. You should totally go here. Nice and small place. Very homey.
author: Jack W.

description: As I walked into the restaurant, a host convinced me that I didn't make a reservation and offered me the cold wind whipped sidewalk instead of the warm waiting area.  And I haven't even ordered yet.  I guess I didn't fit the profile of the clientele here.  Very sad. In 2014. In the city in which I was born. Wow, San Francisco. Wow.
author: William W.

description:
Thank you Yelpers, without you I would have never found this lovely little gem hidden away in the hordes of other restaurants in the area. 

We visited on a Sunday night and we were able to get a reservation, they were even hospitable enough to seat us when we got there about 20min early. The dining room is cozy and warm, it would be a great place for a date, or, like in our case, two old friends who love wine and amazing food. 

Their wine list does not disappoint, we shared a great bottle of wine and were thankfully allowed to take the remainder home. My companion had the stuffed pork loin, which was truly special. I had the pasta with clams, which was certainly good. We started with the gnocchi covered in this amazing braised ju. I would have licked the plate, but they were nice enough to bring me bread and save me the embarrassment. 

We finished the meal with the flourless chocolate cake. Worth every rich bite. 

This is classic fine-dining in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.
author: Lee W.

description:
Heaven - definitively heaven! 

We come here since two years on special occasions and always leave on cloud nine. I ate the menu up and down and couldn't pick a favorite - every dish is out of this world and I'm not exaggerating! Sam, the owner, treated us like friends from the first time we came here and he makes us feel special on every visit.

Albona = Happiness
author: Jfn S.

description: Small, romantic, quietly nestled on a side street. The cooks in the kitchen were obviously trained well. The stuffed pork loin (a disaster in almost every restaurant that offers it) was succulent and tender and absolutely perfect. The panna cotta - a bland quivering mess in inexperienced hands - was divine. Full of richness and vanilla. The owner takes orders, serves food, and makes sure everyone is happy. An amazing blend of the best of Istrian cuisine.
author: Dee G.

description:
Dinner at Albona was easily one of the best meals I've ever had the pleasure of enjoying. 

Everything from start to finish was absolutely perfect including the ambiance, service, and of course the food. 

The two of us had a Bloomspot deal which we paid $70 for a $120 4 course meal. The deal was a great buy and gave us the chance to try Albona out when we wouldn't have heard of them otherwise. The voucher included 2 appetizers, one pasta dish to share, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts.

The chef was extremely welcoming and gracious. He welcomed us as we arrived and came over and chatted us up for about 10 minutes as we were finishing up the meal. He seemed genuinely interested in us and how we enjoyed the meal. 

Our server did an excellent job. He was attentive, knowledgeable, and very pleasant and friendly.

We had the scallops, gnocchi, and ravioli for to start. I had the veal shank and my cousin had the salmon special. Both entrees were exquisite. The veal shank melted in my mouth and was beautiful to look at. Served with warm risotto the dish was a large portion and as good as a piece of meat gets. 

The scallops were very tender and delicious. The ravioli was definitely the best I've had- divine! 

For dessert I had the tiramisu and it was amazing. So good. I could go on and on about how good Albona was. We had a bottle of Pinot Noir from Italy. The bottle was about $42 and was very tasty. Our server recommended it to us and was proud to serve us the wine. He even gave us each a free glass of the same wine once our bottle was gone! 

The owner actually thanked us for buying the Bloomspot deal which I have never experienced before. As the other reviewer mentioned, many times owners and servers have a negative reaction to a deal but this was completely different. They are opening a second Albona in Bend which I look forward to trying. 

Thank you for the perfect meal on our first night in San Francisco! It was a meal I will never forget.
author: Chelsea J.

description: The service is awesome, and the food was delicious. I felt very welcomed and enjoyed the atmosphere. The food portions are big, sharing with someone is recommended. Thanks so much for the awesome experience! I will definitely be coming back when I come visit San Fran!
author: Brenda G.

description:
I really wanted to like this place and things started well but we hit some major snags along the way.

Nice looking restaurant, with about 15-20 tables.

We parked outside the restaurant, thinking it had valet as the kerb was marked for loading.  Came into the restaurant to check with the staff, it took about 5 minutes to get anyone's attention (a minor infraction) and this was with only one table in use.  But they said no issue stay parked.  Which was nice as i was ready to hunt down some parking while my family sat.

We were seated, TABLE #2, and it really took a while for the staff to get things together.  Ordering wine took a while and we had to ask twice for one of the beers, (okay again a minor infraction).  Wine list needs some work and could do with more wines within the $50-$100 range rather than at $50/$100.

Chef came out chatted about the specials and what he could create.  That was nice.

We ordered appetizers and the chef also sent out a complimentary salad.  Yet another nice jester.

3 of 4 entrees came.  Now the snags get a tad above minor.  My entrees came - wrong order - lamb chops and not the veal shank.  We were questioned were we sure, we said we told our waitress twice and the wrong order had mustard which i don't eat.  No acknowledgment or apology, but i will say that's a minor infraction.  We saw her go back to her station look at the order she had written down and realise she had messed up.  As the others ate i waited, about 10 minutes, before another waiter came by to say my meal was on its way.  Yet another 10 minutes passed and my family were essentially done.  I had to go to the kitchen to find our waiter and ask he cancel my order and just bring the bill.  10 more minutes passed before this new waiter said he was bringing out the meal and it would be free.  Nice but we are done and ready to leave.

What i ate and my family ate was good.  That said the service was worse than spotty from our waitress and the fact she dealt so badly with the order was inexcusable.

The bill came and the only thing that was comped was my meal which i didnt touch.

I cant recommend going back and may be this was a once in a life time issue.  Given this bill was $220 for 3 meals and a mid-cost wine, 2 stars is more than they deserve
author: Des D.

description: The Rabbit and Lamb dishes were excellent.  Also one of rare spots where you can strike up a conversation with other customers.  Service was very prompt.  I would definitely go back to try more!
author: Bijan V.

description: Loved this restaurant!! The food was absolutely amazing! I ordered the organic salad and mussels for starters. The filet mignion was great too and the apple strudel. The owner is super friendly too. I will definitely come back!
author: Reem L.

description:
"Hello and welcome to Albona. We've been waiting 26 years to serve you." - Sam

Clearly, I have waited too damn long to eat here. Albona is one the best restaurants I have ever dined in. According to Yelp categories, this is an Italian restaurant. False. Albona is an Istrian restaurant, which technically makes it a Croatian restaurant. Živjeli!

Unfortunately, Yelp doesn't have a "Croatian" category on their website. Luckily, their programming team has managed to add a "Hipster" category. It's good to know Yelp HQ has its priorities straight. I could care less about the country of Croatia, which has some of the finest beaches, women, and food in the world. As long as I can be categorized on Yelp, my inner hipster can rest easy at night.

The Djevojka took me here as part an "All Things Croatian" themed gift, which was pretty much a day jam filled with a Croatian breakfast, wine, beer, lunch, snacks, soccer jerseys, dinner, and of course, her. Yes, I'm spoiled.

In advance, she had made a reservation with Sam who happened to be our host for the evening. Sam is an amazing host. He leads us into the intimate dining room, seated us, greeted us, made food recommendations, organized the food delivery, introduced each dish, refilled our wine glasses, and pretty much did everything in his power to ensure our dinner experience was perfect. Well, he succeeded.

Luckily, for Sam, the food just happens to amazing at Albona. The appetizers were delicious. The dungeness crab appetizer made my eyes roll to the back of my head. And the pan fried gnocchi appetizer was so good, I nearly made a mess in my pants.

I settled down, took a deep breath, and managed to compose myself for the amazing entrees. The Djevojka ordered the stuffed pork loin. It was an explosion of flavors. I ordered the rabbit. Who needs listen to Sting and learn about tantric sex, when each bite of this dish is like a mini orgasm?

For dessert, the dark chocolate-Amaretto flan and crème brûlée were really good. So good, I was licking each dessert dish. The Djevojka shot me a look, but I think she was secretly pleased by uncouth, caveman-like actions. There's only one other time a gentleman such as myself acts like a caveman, and this is not the forum to discuss that. *Clears Throat*

In the end, Albona was an outstanding 4-star dining experience. But the extra star is for Sam, our "star" of the evening who went above and beyond to make our visit to Albona a memorable one. As it turns out, Sam is not just the host. He is also the owner and executive chef. His wife is the pastry chef. It truly is a small operation serving up big flavors. It just adds the intimate dining experience at Albona.

I waited 26 years to eat at Albona. I waited too damn long. Please don't make the same mistake I made. 

Živjeli!
author: Archie G.

description:
The owner was very nice and I wish I could give this place a better review because of how absolutely kind and accommodating he was.
But unfortunately the food was not as good as the reviews led me to believe. The food left me wanting on more then one level. Yes, I could have asked for another dish, but I had no guarantee I would not be charged for it. Also, I would sit, waiting until the alternate meal was cooked. 

Read the fine print. We used a Travel Zoo for $65 and after our meal we were charged full price Tax and 18% Gratuity, so it essentially negated our travel zoo discount. Our 9 day trip was full of Travel Zoo and unfortunately they were the only restaurant to take it from the customer After handing over the Travel Zoo.   

Again the staff and owner were excellent but from their Yelp review and the Travel zoo experience this place didn't work out.
author: Brad K.

description:
It is the heaven! The food is so delicious, that you don't even mind their prices. We had 2 appetizers(don't remember the names), pasta (Strudel con pasta fatta in casa) and 2 entrees (braised veal shank  and  braised Rabbit). Before the meal, they' ll serve you bread (ok) with wheap butter (almost like sour cream).  Both of the meats were so tender and tasteful, that we finished everything, even though were very full. Pasta had to be wrapped to go. The dessert was too much, but I couldn't have left without trying it. It was 100% worth it!
It's actually a hard-to-find place. i would never knew about this restaurant if not the Bloomspot. When we walked in, it was really busy, only 1 table empty - ours. Good we had a reservation. Service was great, our server took time to give some recommendations. 
I'd love to be back!
author: Anastasia B.

description: Intimate, authentic, innovative European dining experience in a quintessential North Beach neighborhood setting.  Service was attentive and extremely knowledgeable, and the kitchen turned out unforgettable and delicious treats. We loved the beet tartar and sardine starters, and the fisherman's stew and lamb chops were each spectacular main dishes.  We can't wait to return!!
author: Heather C.

description:
This place is a must do!  Very small, intimate, neighborhood restaurant.

Service is great.

We started with a great bottle of wine.

The soup of the day was a mushroom (no cream- just mushroomy goodness topped with pancetta and fresh parm)

I had the gnocchi with a brown sauce flavored with cumin (little bits of sirloin and mushroom).  These gnocchi were like little light potato pillows.

As a table we shared the mushroom risotto with fresh parm.  After eating this, I almost wasn't sure if I could continue- it was SO FREAKING FANTASTIC, but I did...

For my main dish, I choose the 3-cheese ravioli with brown butter sage sauce.  WOW,WOW,WOW   I paused while eating a couple of times just to savor it. 

If I ever make it back to San Francisco, this will be my spot!
author: M M.

description: Complete gem. Intimate setting, lovely food, and impeccable service. Highly recommend to locals and tourists alike.
author: Heather S.

description:
Phenomenal. Food was so great. Atmosphere was nice & laid back. Prices were very reasonable. Sam takes so much pride in this place & it shows.

I had veal shank & my wife had strudel pasta. Both melted in your mouth. 

Just a wonderful place. Highly recommended
author: Christian H.

description: I came here again for NYE dinner. It was my first time visiting this restaurant in 2 years and it is just as good now as it was then. The staff was very friendly and the ambiance is still the same. I ordered the Mushroom Risotto (my favorite) once again while my boyfriend ordered the  strudel con pasta fatta which is a yelp favorite. Both dishes were awesome and surprisingly both vegetarian! (We are devoted meat eaters) It is refreshing that there is a restaurant in SF that hasn't changed its standards in food and service. I will be a repeat patron for years to come!
author: Rebecca D.

description: Excellent meal. 4 of us staying at the Sheraton & this was within walking distance. 3 of us had the Strudel Con Pasta Fatta In Casablanca! It was excellent and just as described on the menu. Other person had the Brodeto de lease a la Istriano. Ordered 1/2 portion and was more than enough! Excellent service & atmosphere! Highly recommend!
author: Janice M.

description:
This entire experience was amazing. I went here for dinner using a Groupon deal, and the man who seated us and took our order was quite lovely about it. He offered us two appetizers instead of one to share or getting two soups & two salads (which is what the deal stated), so we got the mussels & potato gnocchi. The white wine tomato sauce that the mussels come in is AMAZING. Dipping the delicious bread into it was heavenly. Also, the gnocchi comes in a sirloin sauce, which was also very delicious. 

We then ordered the rack of lamb entree along with their special of the night which was  mortadella & Parmesan raviolis. Each dish was very flavorful and amazing, however we were SO full after the two huge appetizers that it was a little painful trying to eat everything in our main course. The food was all so good though that I forced myself to finish! 

Our Groupon deal also gave us a dessert to share, but the owner said we could each choose one dessert for ourselves. We were to the point of popping though, so we just got some coffee instead. He even offered to let us take desserts to go, which was so so sweet, but even thinking about food and/or dessert was too much to handle at that point. He was so sweet, funny and nice though, I was very happy that we had this lovely experience. 

Overall, amazing delicious experience in a laidback and intimate setting. I can't wait to go back!
author: Dawn O.

description:
Gayle and I braved a Friday Night rainstorm and an Occupy protest to come into the City and have Dinner at Albona with Ben P. and his lovely wife Amy. Both are moving to Miami next month, and this was a chance to talk about this exciting new chapter in their lives and to catch up since our last dinner together. I'm also hoping that after his move, Ben starts writing Yelp reviews again, regains his Elite Badge, and otherwise enhances the Magic City by his hard work and wicked smart personality. To get him started, Gayle and I presented him and Wifey a copy of Scarface (which includes a digital "F Bomb" counter).

Since we're from the Midwest, all 4 of us arrived early for our 7:30 PM dinner date. Some good neighbourhood parking Karma and a keen eye for locating Albona's understated exterior also helped. Gayle and I also learned quickly that Ben is a "regular" here, or as he joked, it's one of the few situations where his association with a restaurant is a good thing. The practical upshot was that we were well taken care during the evening, starting with a glass of Prosecco when we first sat down. That high level of service continued through 2 appetizers, a couple bottles of excellent red wine, the main courses, dessert, and being greeted and thanked by the Chef at the end.  You would think that Ben and Amy were VIPs here, but I did make sure that we split the check even with all that charm, class, and wit that was flying around.

The dining room was well appointed, intimate, and was very conducive to the engaging and enjoyable 3 hour dinner conversation that ensued. Our lives intersect in various places (like St. Louis Park, MN) and it was fun to talk from various common frames of reference. The food was also fabulous, and when you combine that with the ambiance, the service, and the company, times like this make me wish I could throw in a 6th Star for Gestalt.
author: Eric B.

description: Dinner was a triple threat; lamb, pork loin, rabbit. Great flavored, presentation and just enough service. Pinot by the glass was exceptional. Don't hesitate. Go there tonight!
author: Barry G.

description:
Date night, we dropped in early Saturday evening without a reservation (before it became quickly crowded), and we were early enough to get seated.  Samuel (the gracious and friendly owner) greeted us right away -- cozy, intimate, classic San Francisco charm with excellent service, attentive, but they know when to give a couple their time together as we sat along the booth wall side by side.

This Istrian restaurant flavors come alive starting with the Dungeness crab salad (with lots of tasty crab), their signature grandmother's specialty -  pan-fried potato gnocchi balls in a brown sirloin sauce laced with cumin, delicious!  Then on to the tender rack of Lamb with Dijon mustard & herb crust served with a potato, eggplant and pesto napoleon.  Ending the meal with Panna Cotta with port wine and berries was decadent to share.  Eating here is a must-do!
author: Susan S.

description:
Solid dining experience!  We had a Bloomspot deal, and this was perfect because I've been wanting to try Albona.  We got a LOT of food: two appetizers, one pasta to share, two entrees and two desserts - woo!  We each got a glass of red Croatian wine called Birbich - mmm, deep with a little bit of sweetness, nice!  

We ordered:
* Fresh calamari (mmm, this was yummy, definitely a highlight!)
* Gnocchi (this was good, sauce was different than I'm used to but good)
* Homemade ravioli with three kinds of cheeses (mmm, good, definitely another highlight!)
* Lamb (my friend liked hers)
* Seafood stew (ooo, when I go to an Italian restaurant and this is on the menu, this is my go-to, my standard to test and compare, mmmm, the seafood was sooo fresh!! I couldn't finish it though because I was getting full fast.  My bf completely enjoyed the leftovers later that night though!)
* Apple streudel (mmm, the flavors melded together so nicely, yumm)
* Bonet (dark chocolate, creamy)
....they didn't have the tiramisu....ohhhh disappointed....but the streudel almost made up for it.  

Service was sweet and nice, explained the menu nicely.  They got real busy halfway through our meal, so they were a little slow to check on us later when we got full with our entrees and were waiting to have them boxed.  Then, it took awhile for them to come around to take our dessert order.  But it's all forgiven...they were very nice.  

Grazie!
author: Maile N.

description: Small place with very friendly staff and great food. The peach and Gorgonzola salad was delicious. The staff are very busy so plan on a wait. Would not recommend going here if you are in a rush. We went Saturday night around 7:15pm.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
3.5 Stars, rounded up to 4 stars.

The food was good, but not incredible.

I ordered the rabbit, which was surprisingly not very "gamey". Instead, it tasted very close to duck. The only problem was that the sweet-citrus sauce became a bit too acidic toward the end and I could not finish the meal. 4 stars

I also noticed everyone raving about the streudel ice cream. I ordered it but wasn't a huge fan of the raisins. I prefer salty-sweet desserts or at least savory-sweet but I felt it was too sweet. This may have been because I had just finished the rabbit and the sweet aftertaste was overwhelming. 3 stars

My husband had the Penne a la "arrabbiata". It was a very simple dish, nothing fancy. The portions were definitely hearty, but it tasted like pasta you could get anywhere, although I did like the tomatoes used in the marinara. 3 stars.

For appetizers we ordered the mushroom soup, pear with gorgonzola cheese, and truffle salad. I liked the mushroom soup a lot, even though I don't like mushrooms. The pear is drizzled in sweet sauce and paired with a sharp blue cheese, and I enjoyed that immensely. Truffle salad was a bit over-truffle sauced, if that's a word.

Was hoping to find somewhere identical to what we had in Tuscany. I wish we had ordered differently and maybe I would have enjoyed it more.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Wow, hadn't returned to Albona for about 5 years, after enjoying several meals there (even having a party for a 90-year old there!).  Brought the family for dinner tonight, and everything was wonderful.  Excellent food, well-selected wine, attentive service.  And the restaurant isn't huge and nosy, making it a particularly nice place to enjoy a meal with friends and family.  Why, we were asking ourselves, has it taken us so long to return?
author: Em C.

description:
Ok food not sure why this place gets such great reviews and 4 plus stars 
Nothing special service is ok
author: Sandeep B.

description:
Came here for the first time today, won't be my last. Service from Sam was welcoming and perfect, he really makes it that 5 star experience. Food was awesome and worth every penny.

Had:

-Insalata di rugola: very lightly dressed salad, could have used a few more apples for balance but a nice light starter for a heavy meal
-Penne a la "arrabbiata": perfectly cooked pasta with that al dente bounce.
-Strudel con pasta: wide pasta noodles baked with cheese and creamy sauce, perfect for cheese lovers
-Panna cotta: thick, creamy, dreamy...loved it, gives you that really satisfied feeling especially if you're a dessert lover. Latte for dessert was good too, foam was super thick and creamy.

Small and cozy, perfect for intimate dinners and staff are always around if you need anything. This restaurant saved the day after a poor experience for lunch elsewhere on my day trip to the city.
author: Megan K.

description: I ate here with a group of 12. We tried many dishes off the menu and everything was either very good or excellent. In addition to Italian food, there are Croatian and Austrian dishes. Some of the items were mouth watering delicious such as the risotto with mushrooms and a strudel dish that is actually similar to lasagna but far better than any lasagna I've ever had. The dining room is intimate and quiet. Street parking is easy. The wait staff was efficient and accommodating of our large group.  Our group will be returning again and again. This is a gem of a restaurant. Definitely worth trying!
author: Katharine J.

description:
My husband and I just finished dinner at Albona and it was WONDERFUL!  

Everything is homemade (including the desserts) and it was all delicious (cold sardines and sauerkraut/sausage appetizer; lamb and seafood pasta entrees; panna cotta and tiramisu for dessert - yummy!).  I'm not sure how some of the Yelp reviewers couldn't like the food, but we will definitely be going back and then we can see if there is consistency.  Seriously, I wanted to try everything on the menu!

The owner/chef, Sam, was a delight and truly enjoys his craft.  He met all of his guests at the door and was very warm and welcoming.  

We also dined on the Travel Zoo voucher and I was surprised to see the 18% tip included in the final bill. I normally would have said something, but the owner was so delightful, I decided to let it pass (but it was a bit annoying). 

Other than the tip thing, my only complaint, and this is very minor (but it is the reason for the 4, not 5 star review) was the service.  The waiters all had a wonderful attitude/demeanor, but the actual "service" portion of the evening could be stepped up a notch i.e. training.  For example, the server mixed up our orders on both the appetizer and the main course (between just my husband and I).  When we were finished with our dinner, it took a long time for someone to come and ask us about dessert and each time a waiter walked by the table (including the time when they actually served our dessert), they just left our empty wine glass and a juice can, which we had neatly placed on the front of the table for pick up.  I feel bad even mentioning this, but there really is no excuse for not providing top notch service in such a small restaurant which was well staffed for the size of the restaurant (we were there on a Thurs).  

The service issue aside, this is currently my "go-to" Italian restaurant and I can't wait to try more of their food!
author: Jerolyn D.

description:
Really great authentic Italian experience. Friendly, good prices. Did not charge to split salad, complimentary side of risotto. Relaxed atmosphere, not fancy.
Could use a bit of a renovation especially the bathrooms. This is a small point for me though. I've traveled a bit in Italy, this meal brought back some nice memories:)
author: Carlos D.

description:
Got reservations last minute on a holiday weekend after our first choice dining fell through, and what a lucky break that was! 

After arriving 30min early, we were warmly welcomed by the owner and served glasses of wine while we waited. 

As for our meal, it was promptly served by a knowledgeable host who offered some stellar recommendations on the menu. The food was absolutely fantastic, and an interesting variation of traditional Italian food. 

Highlights:

braised sauerkraut (amazing flavors - favorite) 
Grandmother's specialty (perfectly cooked and the cumin was interesting) 
Arugala salad (delicious)

Pasta 'strudel' - tons of fresh basil and heavy flavors, a very classic Italian taste
Butter and sage pasta - fantastic simple flavors, a much lighter choice than the strudel with the same wow factor. I would have a tough time choosing between these two entrees. (depends on my mood) 

The deserts were also excellent. 

This place rocked, it had a great staff and amazing food - highly recommend it.
author: Lucas S.

description:
Still crazy after all these years!

This is our "go to" place.  We go for all our celebrations, and have never been disappointed.  In 3 years, I will turn 50. Watch out Albona: I want my party at your place!!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
We were headed to Cobb's Comedy Club for a show, and our friends said they love this local Istrian (I had to look it up) restaurant, so we met them there for dinner.

Albona is a cozy local restaurant. It feels fancy yet warm and welcoming. The staff is very friendly and attentive.

The menu had a lot of items that looked interesting, but this is what we settled on:

Asparagus soup (of the day) - You know a soup is good when the bowl looks like it just came out of the cabinet when you're done eating. Smooth and flavorful.

Grandma's specialty pan-fried potato gnocchi in a brown sirloin sauce - The easy way to describe these is that they're fancy tater tots. Apologies to grandma, but this was just okay. Nothing wrong with it, but nothing that made me desire to order it again.

Caramelized pears with Fontina chesse and gastrique sauce - This was quite excellent. Every bit of it. I think my favorite was the fontina cheese.

Mushroom risotto - Prominent mushroom flavor was quite nice, but I like my risotto cooked a little more than this. A bit too crunchy for my taste (but it was my friend's dish, so it wasn't my place to comment on it to the wait staff.)

Strudel con pasta fatta in casa - fresh pasta roll filled with slices of prosciutto & Lappi cheese; baked in a casserole with toasted bread crumbs, béchamel, & tomato-cream sauce - My wife ordered this, and I was able to get a small bite before she scarfed the rest of it down. This had some nice flavors and was very rich. It might be a bit too rich for me to have eaten it myself, but the bite was very enjoyable.

Rack of Lamb - This was pretty amazing. A nice salty crust, and perfectly cooked meat. The potato, eggplant and pesto napoleon was a wonderful accompaniment.

Overall, this was a very enjoyable experience. We'll definitely look into another visit the next time we're in the area.
author: Jason G.

description: Sam Hernandez is not only an incredible chef, but also a wonderful host. The food we ate tonight (gnocchi, arugula salad, strudel and seafood pasta) was well prepared, delicious and served with a story. As if that wasn't enough, we drank great wine paired with magical panna cotta. Yum.
author: Ani N.

description: On the basis of Yelp reviews, I booked a business dinner here. To report that we were NOT disappointed would be a gross understatement! The mushroom soup was amazing: three types of mushrooms, vegetable broth, and potatoes with no cream or butter. I'm not vegan (or vegetarian), but I found the soup to be much more pleasing than a traditional cream of mushroom soup. Plus, it left room for the Veal Shank with Polenta, which was the best I've had since I was in northern Italy. My colleagues had the rabbit and the chicken and spoke highly of both. To top it off, the service was attentive without being intrusive, and the wines were very reasonably priced. I'll be going back soon!
author: Bob S.

description:
Synopsis: 3 stars for the food; bonus star for the friendly, attentive service.

Albona had been on my radar for many years, as I was curious about the twist Istrian cuisine would provide over classic Italian fare.

Based on the recommendations of other Yelpers, we tried the following dishes:

Chifeleti de mia nona con sugo de carne al cumin: pan-fried gnocchi in a brown sirloin sauce laced with cumin. This reminded us more of "big tator tots" rather than gnocchi, but was tasty! If you like tator tots, you should love this dish.

Strudel con pasta fatta in casa: fresh pasta roll filled with slices of prosciutto & Lappi cheese; baked in a casserole with toasted bread crumbs, béchamel, & tomato-cream sauce. Basically, an Istrian version of lasagne. We also enjoyed this dish - it's rich and tasty.

Stinco de videl a la Triestina: braised veal shank in a Burgundy wine and rosemary glaze served with soft polenta. It's hard to go wrong with braised meat, but the dish was not executed very well - at least on that night. The veal shank was slightly overcooked and under-seasoned, and the polenta tasted undercooked.

Sadly, we were too full for dessert.
author: Steve L.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary and had a wonderful experience! I saw that this restaurant had a very high rating. I read some reviews and realized that this was an Istrian restaurant. I've never had Istrian cuisine before, so I thought it would be nice to try something different. I made a pretty last minute reservation and they managed to fit us in for an early dinner at 5pm on a Saturday. 

Upon arrival, we were greeted by a super friendly and enthusiastic fellow named Sam. Later on, we discovered that he was the owner/chef. From beginning to end, the service was fantastic! Sam, as well as the staff, were all very friendly. The exterior, as well as the interior, was adorable! It's a really nice place to have a quiet and intimate dinner.  

Anyway, I think it's time to talk about the food! For our appetizer, we ordered the pan-fried potato gnocchi in a brown sirloin sauce with cumin. The gnocchi was fried to perfection! It was very soft on the inside and lightly crisp on the outside. The sauce was pretty good. If you're a fan of curry, you'll enjoy this dish. For my entree, I ordered the halibut which was served in a light lemon, white wine, shallot and butter sauce and was served with sauteed vegetables. The sauce was amazing! If anything, the fish may have been a tad overcooked. I think it could have been softer. But don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed my dish, the sauce really made up for it! My boyfriend had the rack of lamb. I'm generally not a huge fan of lamb, but I thought it was quite good. The meat was very flavorful and tender. 

Overall, this place gets a solid 4 stars in my book. Amazing service and good food! I can see myself coming back in the near future.
author: Christine B.

description:
One star for service. It was pretty good service. Since we just ate a crab cocktail on the wharf, we were not too hungry. The staff was so great about dividing up the food into two bowls, glasses, etc.  Since the yelp rating was so high, we didn't think we would be able to get in without reservations.  We were there early in the evening and the waiter was able to accommodate us (and the place was 1/2 empty).
As French G stated, the mushroom was too peppery.  The potato gnocchi was a fancy fried tater tot. THe best part of the meal was the risotto. Very good taste, fair asking price at 18. We had the sardine appetizer, mostly to try something different and it was very heavy. Actually every item on the menu was "heavy". 
While the menu is in Italian, the food is venetian Italian and very different that what I was use to. I will not go back. It was just one of those bad YELP adventures.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Oh my gosh this place is yummy!  The service was outstanding and the food was delish!  We made reservations but came about an hour early and they were so sweet and nice and nothing but accommodating.  I love this place and it was far better than places bigger and fancier.  Trust me you have to go here!
author: Kristine S.

description:
Chef Samuel Hernandez has crafted a home cooked menu that is flavorful, authentic, and artful. The service was excellent from waiter Eddie and the tiramisu & chocolate flan dessert were delicious. My young adult sons were welcomed in an intimate and classy dining room. Our desserts were complimentary per the chef just because we were friendly and conversed with all the staff throughout our meal. Our experience was memorable and we'll come back whenever visiting San Francisco!

EasyEd
author: Isiah P.

description: We're visiting from Singapore and had a Fab dinner.  Great service , excellent food - especially Adriatic stew , veal shank and seafood linguine . Flavors and style reminded us of some food we've had in Italy .
author: Harry S.

description: Pears and Gorgonzola appetizer was excellent as was the rolled pasta. Very flavorful. The desert was good but not great. Otherwise a real gem of a find.
author: Paul O.

description:
I just can't say enough wonderful things about this place!  

I hadn't been here for a long time, almost 3 years. When we go there, we were greeted by Sam, the Owner/Chef.  What a charming man!  This man knows what Hospitality is!
We were seated and I told Sam, I hadn't been here in quite a few years and I'd missed it!  So what does he do?  He steps away ans brings us over a glass of Champagne and welcomes me back.  WOW!

Onto the food.  So we start with a Tomato Soup.  No cream, but made creamy with potatoes.  IT was a tad salty, but I still devoured the dish!

We shared the gnocchi.  Which is unlike any other I've had.  Light and fluffy, more like a croquette than a gnocchi.  And the Cumin Sauce.. WOW!
We then told Sam, we couldn't decide on a pasta or entree and would be sharing anyway.
We told him we were going with the Rabbit and to just pick a pasta course that complimented it.  So we did a pasta course and the rabbit.
The Pasta was a house made ravioli in browned butter with butter fried sage.  I wanted more!
The rabbit was divine!  
And then ANOTHER Surprise!  Sam brought us a complimentary glass of Red Wine for the rabbit course!

Dessert was the gelato and a vanilla pannacotta.  

As Sam was leaving that night, he stopped by and thanked us again for coming into eat,  What a gracious host!

This is just one of the best Gems of the city!  I will be back soon Sam!!!!

Thank you for a magical night!
author: David H.

description: Had a fine bottle of wine with my pasta roll with prosciutto - one of the best Italian meals ever in SF.
author: Carolina E.

description: Amazing truffleriffic arugula salad.   Awesome pear and gorgonzola app.  Very reasonably priced Italian weighted wine list. Enormous and tasty entrees.  Biscotti + visciolla was a great desert pairing.
author: Ben B.

description: We have been here yesterday for my husbands birthday and it was  a great experience. The interior is really cosy and the restaurant is rather small. It looks like you are in Italy and the staff is also very european. They are super nice and don't take your empty plate away while your partner is still eating. They know their menu and have really good recommendations for food and wine. The food was delicious, we had the veal and the salmon. Everything tasted really fresh with a lot of herbs. The dessert for my husband was on the house as it was his birthday. All in all it was a pleasant experience and we will definitely go again.
author: Daniela K.

description: Food is amazing and the service is phenomenal.  I come here every year for my birthday as it's my favorite restaurant in SF.  We have difficult dietary needs (I'm a vegetarian and my husband is gluten-free) and they always accommodate with a smile.  The prosciutto arugula salad,  catch of the day, and Sam's marina sauce are must haves.  Highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends and anyone reading this review.  Would give it 10 stars if available.  Consider this a hidden gem in our neighborhood.
author: Mila P.

description:
Just wanted to follow up, given evens that occurred.

The day after I posted my review here, my cell phone rings. It is the Chef at Albona calling (hmm, may be I should start using an alias?! creepy...) 

He has read my review and is quite displeased and agitated over it. He says he can't make me like his food, but that he will refund us the money for the dinner. He does not expect that I pull the review in return. 

I say that he should not refund us anything - after all, we tried his place, we didn't like it, we will not return - such is life. He insists; says goodbye.

Just checked my card - he did give us our money back. I have to respect that.
author: Margarita B.

description: Albona is amazing. The restaurant is in an easy location, close to the wharf and north beach, and the environment is relaxed and welcoming. Our waiter was friendly and very helpful in guiding us to the best menu choices. We started with the tomato soup -- delicious -- and warm fig salad, which was one of the best dishes of the night. I'll be going back just for the fig salad. Next, we had the lamb and stroganoff. The portions were perfect and the entrees were all very reasonably priced. We didn't leave anything on the plate. Dessert's also a must at this place. The chef's wife is a pastry chef and we had an awesome piece of chocolate cake. We'll definitely be going back again soon. It's easy to see why this place has as many awards as it does.
author: Thomas B.

description: A fine Italian restaurant, tucked away in a residential area. Inside has a real elegant look, good for a romantic date ;). The food here is of top notch quality. Grandmother's Specialty is something that you would probably want to get; it's pan-fried potato gnocchi in a brown sirloin sauce laced with cumin that puts most of the gnocchi out there to shame. Parking does suck though (as in most places around SF) since there is no lot or reserve spaces for this place, you'll have to look for one somewhere in neighbor streets. Valet is just them cruising around for you, trying to find the same street parking.
author: Nam B.

description:
OK, my bubble of being in love with this place shattered when hubby and I went there for dinner on Valentine's day. First, being a small family run place Albona is, I didn't think they would be trapping people with over-priced Valentine's day dinner menu (which is why we chose this place but my bad for not calling and asking. I looked on the website and the website didn't mention anything).

So we walk in, find out there is $95 pp four-course Valentine's Day Menu tonight. What broke my heart when I noticed the pork loin dish was not on the menu. First course, soup was bland. Calamari appetizer was alright but the veal entree was disappointing. And to top it all, our server (he seemed new, as we remembered the rest of the staff from our last visit) was kinda loud and rude. So Albona! sad to say our relationship ends here, you won't be seeing me again..
author: Kanwal A.

description:
My friend and I just had a great meal at this little gem restaurant in San Francisco. The food was tastefully prepared with a combination of Italian,  Croatian,  and German cuisines. 

Not to be missed is the gnocchi with sirloin sauce and the ravioli with sage butter. 

Our server Joe gave us good advise on our selections and all the staff was very friendly.
author: Sue S.

description:
A hidden gem near Fisherman's Wharf.
BTW walking distance from the Hilton Fisherman's Wharf.
We found this on the yelp listings and decided to go there.... you need to make a reservation. But we luckily the first person we were greeted by was the Owner/Chef Sam and they were really busy on a Tuesday night @ 8:00 but he let us have a table. SCORE!
 
Pros:
Food is awesome.: 
NOTE: we were in SF for a week
First time there - Had the Mushroom soup and also Mushroom Risotto and the gnocchi (very fully and light). mmmmmmm AWESOME. 
Then went on Thursday to pickup some desert (just because we didn't have desert there on Tuesday night) - Tiramisu and the bonet (dark chocolate amaretto flan),
Finally we decide to go back on Friday for dinner again and have a big dinner. MMMMMM had the Lamb. cooked to perfection. Strudel con pasta fatta in casa  (fresh pasta roll filled with slices of prosciutto & Lappi cheese; baked in a casserole
with toasted bread crumbs, béchamel, & tomato-cream sauce), Poached pears with gorganzola..... mmmmmm and then lastly had some panna cotta and the strudel de pomi. Cant say enough about it!

Ok back to everything else pro:
Fresh and different from many Italian restaurants in SF.
Small & Cozy
Staff is awesome, they are very attentive but not over the top.

Cons:
Small , You might get bumped into by people passing your table.
Sometime you see some unsavory types on the street in front of the place.
Tried to have some people that i met @ the hotel make reservations for Saturday for their dinner but i guess they had a private party. :(

An awesome experience, will do again when im in the city.
author: Roy K.

description: We stumbled upon this gem after a long day of touring the city. Great food, great service and great experience. Highly recommend stepping away from the wharf area for a truly authentic and well prepared Italian meal.
author: Becky T.

description:
Great service, great environment, great food!  Located on a quiet street sits this really small 8 table restaurant.  This restaurant reminds me of the small NY restaurants I'm use to.  I made reservations for 7 for my cousin's bachelorette dinner.  They were able to accommodate us.  I was able to taste everything everyone ordered.  

The things we ordered: 

Stinco de videl a la Triestina - Braised Veal Shank, was really tasty.  The meat falls off the bone.  
Involtin de porco con capuzi garbi e prosuto - Pork Loin with Proscuitto, sauerkraut, red cabbage was not dry and pairings are good together. 
Catch of the day - Salmon in Lemon sauce, cooked really well and really tasty.  The bread goes well with the sauce as well. 
Penne a la "arrabbiata"  -  Really good pasta and you can taste the garlic and tomato sauce. 
Arugula with granny smith apples, mushrooms & prosciutto in a white truffle vinaigrette - Perfectly seasoned. 
Sauerkraut soup - Really yummy. 

We stayed to chit chat until the restaurant closed and they didn't rush us out or anything.  We felt bad so we left on our own.
author: Alice T.

description: Nothing wrong with the food that I can put my finger on but it really was not my cup of tea.
author: Prerona M.

description:
Barry took me to Albona last night for dinner before going to the America's Cup Pavilion to see the Doobies and Steve Miller Band. About a 10 minute walk.
The ambiance of Albona is wonderful the service was top notch. Not just one server helping you they all are paying attention to whatever you may need. The food delicious and creatively prepared. The chef came out to check with every table to make sure we were all satisfied with our meals. He even served us more water. I simply can't wait to go back it is my San Francisco restaurant.
I have never yelped a restaurant before so you know I was impressed.
Sally Iannarelli
P.S. You must have the coffee gelato
author: Sally I.

description:
A strong recommendation by a friend in the neighborhood plus a Bloomspot "feast" offer provided an outcome of a food lust for all dishes Istrian. Please make a reservation and get prepared to enjoy an excellent meal in an intimate and pleasant environment. I heartily recommend sharing your dishes with if that's at all palatable to you.

Albona takes pride in making Istrian food, which derives from Italy, Croatia, and Slovenia, and leads to robust variants of dishes we know elsewhere. Sam, the owner and executive chef, waited on us during Friday dinner of Labor Day weekend. No rest for the weary; this was a tough table to get despite the call of Black Rock City and other sunny vacation spots. (Yes, my review is a couple months overdue.) 

My girlfriend and I enjoyed course after course. We began laughing a bit as the meal progressed as the fullness of our growing stomachs tried to fight back against enjoying more of each superb combination of flavors. The braised veal, strudel pasta, and risotto with mushrooms still come to mind. Oh, and the penne a la arrabbiata was both spicy and fresh. 

Buses and taxis (and someday, the T line) are close by on Columbus Ave. Parking in this area of North Beach isn't easy, but not as tough as Grant Ave., for instance. You might need to walk a block or two but after this meal, a little exercise wouldn't be the worst idea.
author: Mike H.

description:
We went to Albona Ristorante Istriano for a birthday dinner and it was an amazing experience.  The owner, Sam, greeted us personally and when he learned that it was my birthday, he gave each of us a glass of special champagne to enjoy.

The meal itself was delicious.  Everything from the appetizers (squid stuffed with fish and the mushroom risotto) to the special of the day (Chinook Salmon) to the Braised Veal Shank was outstanding!  For dessert, Sam gave each of us a tiramisu with birthday candle.  We also ordered their famous Bonet (chocolate flan) and strawberry sorbet.  Sam's wife is also the Pastry Chef, so all of the desserts are homemade.

The service was outstanding.  Sam is the epitome of a gracious and generous host who strives to provide the best service possible.  Like he said, "The customer is always right!"

The restaurant is fairly small, so reservations are a must if you don't want to wait a long time.  Parking can also be a challenge, so plan accordingly.  Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Zoey W.

description:
Food was just average for the four of us. Went last night prior to a concert at Bimbo 365 two blocks over.  The wait staff very friendly and service attentive; but the food lacked the "wow" factor. 

Our friends shared the arugula salad; hubby and I shared the asparagus spears salad; and we all shared the potato gnocchi. They liked their salad; we the asparagus; and we all stared at the gnocchi when first brought to the table. Not like any gnocchi we've had. Looked liked deep fried nuggets, and just tasted like mashed potatoes with a cumin smell. WEIRD. 

Entrees - no rack of lamb available but a lamb stew in its place. So one had the lamb stew; two of us the braised rabbit; and one had the veal shank. 

The chef comes out to check on everything, and said if you don't like what you ordered, let him know, and he'll replace. Our friend didn't like his rabbit, so ordered the Adriatic fish stew instead. 

I had the rabbit too, and the chef asked me did I want something else. Rabbit has a tendency to be dry anyway, so I declined and just ate what I could. 

On the tab, the chef made a point of not charging for one rabbit entree because he said he wanted us to come back in the future. So we split the tab into two, and paid $71.00 each inc. tax&tip. None of us had any wine or beverage to drink.

There are so many places to eat in the City so there's no way we're coming back. 

Oh, great bread basket of dinner rolls and French bread.

3.0 stars for the food, and 5.0 for the chef's graciousness.
author: Shirley N.

description: Wonderful experience.  Great service, delicious meal, nice dining room. Would return in a heart beat. Highly recommended it!
author: Laurel N.

description:
I had my reservations about the Italian restaurants in North Beach. This is due to my poor experience at Flor D'Italia (which is right next to this place).

Albona proved me wrong. The owner Samuel was very nice and extremely welcoming. I actually felt appreciated for walking in his restaurant, which is a nice change since most places don't make you feel like that. I came here to take my brother out for his birthday and this was the perfect setting.

Here is what I got:

Wine: 
Abuzza Wine Bottle - This red wine tasted like a Pinot Noir and it is excellent!

Appetizer: 
Stuffed Calamari - They actually had fresh octopus and it was stuffed with meat covered in red sauce. Definitely recommend

Main course
1. Halibut - The halibut was soft and tasted super fresh.

2. Stuff Pork Loins - I'm usually not a big pork fan, but i definitely enjoyed this dish!

Dessert: 
Tiramisu - This is the real deal, the cake was soft with a great chocolate taste.

I didn't officially order the rabbit because the owner was scared I wouldn't like it. So he brought out a plate for me and my brother to try and it was awesome. The rabbit had a rich taste due to their ridiculously good sauce and the meat was very soft. I definitely recommend this dish if you feel like being adventurous. On top of this dish, the owner also gave us both a glass of sparkling Champaign! 

The service was beyond my expectation, it was better than Gary Dankos and that is saying a lot since I love that place.  I definitely recommend coming here to eat because I'm positive you'll have a great experience.
author: JF K.

description: Amazing food.  Loved the mushroom soup and strudel.  Wanna cotta was a bit too rich but the chocolate flan was excellent.  Great service, too!
author: Heidi L.

description:
Flavour costs extra. You need to ask for the special 'flavour menu' otherwise you are stuck with bland tasteless carby crap. Sure the service is good, but that's because the wait staff know how bad the food really is and feel bad you got sucked in. 

I really regret paying for the meal. Nothing tasted as it should have based on the menu description. Honestly you are better off giving it a miss.
author: Sam S.

description:
I have just came back from Albona and first of all Sam's hospitality  was awesome.
He greeted us with a sense of humor 
We asked him for a recommendation of wine and he bought 2 bottles and opened the first and we tasted it and it was not to our liking and he opened the second one was was really nice and he took away the first one and how many Restaruant do that. 
We had our meal cooked to perfection and there was no hurry to get us out of there and that was what are us so comfortable.
It was fine dining with a personal touch.
Thanks Sam you have not forgotten what it takes to run a personal friendly Restaruant .
Cheers and keep up the good work
author: Benny K.

description: The food was amazing. We were greeted by Sam, the chef/owner at our table side w/ a complimentary appetizer that was fantastic. It's off the beaten path giving a more home feel. My wife and I frequent many restaurants and were very pleased and would recommend.
author: Derek S.

description:
This place truly is a hidden gem. We made reservations, which I guess weren't necessary, because the place was empty (we also ate pretty early though). The food was great and the service was also just as great. We didn't feel rushed at all and were able to take our time throughout the meal. 

I started off with the soup special, asparagus soup and my boyfriend had the potato gnocchi and both were delicious. For our entrees, I had the chicken which was amazing. The broccoli was cooked perfectly and the mashed potato was creamy. The chicken came with two decent sized pieces. They were thin and breaded. Their bread and butter was also amazing. It came out warm and the butter was room temperature and melted onto the bread. 

We will definitely be back! I also like that they are on Eat24.
author: J E.

description: Love love love. Food was heavenly good. Restaurant was cozy. Service was friendly. Pears and gorgonzola was beyond delightful. A lovely choice any night of the week.
author: G M.

description:
I'm afraid I have to reenter my review as it was previously taken down. This makes me question the reviews of this restaurant and transparency on this website in general. Will this review be removed for expressing this opinion? We shall see...

I went to this place with JW. The decor was very generic.  Service left a bit to be desired as well. One of our forks had food stuck on it. Part of our order wasn't delivered.  While the friend gnocchi was good, it wasn't great.  With the abundance of great food choices in SF, Albona simply doesn't measure up.  I would not come back to this place for a few reasons:
1) My experience, and that of my dinner companion, was sub par.  Dirty cutlery and forgetting orders is not going to bring me back.
2) The review was removed. This was the first review that's been removed and I sent an inquiry to yelp who informed me that "guest reviews" were against their policy. Fair enough, but these reviews are of places I have gone to with all the reviewers and, in a foolish attempt to show them how great yelp is, I posted these reviews. I suspect the review was removed at the request of the restaurant owners. The chef actually sent me a nice note and I wrote back stating his concern for the service was appreciated and I would update my review. Much to my surprise and chagrin, when I went to update the review, it had been removed. No increase in rating then!
3) Transparency is essential for good decision making. We depend on it and expect it from sites like Yelp. Without it, reviews are essentially worthless.
author: Zak R.

description:
The first thing you'll notice when you walk into Albona is its "unpretentious" interior, which was undoubtedly romantic, cozy, and family-like. You'll be welcomed by the owner and former executive chef, Sam -- the one who "treats you like family" and "welcomes you to his kitchen" graciously as soon as you walk through the door. Before I delve into the specifics, I'll say that prior to using the Groupon deal we got, I heavily read reviews here on Yelp. As a 4.5 star rating with 450+ reviews, in addition to all the raving reviews about top-notch service and exquisite Istrian cuisine, I think I overall walked into Albona with pretty high expectations. 

With that, as soon as we walked in, Sam welcomed us, immediately thanked us for reserving the night, and sat us at our table. While our Groupon was only good for two entrees, one appetizer, two champagnes, and a dessert, Sam graciously gave me (under 18) a complimentary apple cider and told us we could choose two appetizers, all with a smile on his face. Immediately I felt like we were being treated like kings. They gave us our menu, brought out absolutely delicious home-made rolls that were freshly baked, and gave us their recommendations -- "no pasta," as Sam put it, "today you try something new." Sounded good. 

We ordered the panfried Gnocchi that everybody raved about on here ("Grandma's specialty), in a sirloin sauce "laced with cumin," and the calamari stuffed with white fish and marinara. The Gnocchi was delightful; it's not really a potato dumpling, but rather, a deep fried mashed potato ball with really a European take on curry sauce.
