We just want to thank Michael and his staff for a dining experience that was as delightful as it was delicious. The sardines are a special treat and the rabbit and the sea bass both done to perfection. The rabbit seemed to multiply the more I cut into it.

Yet what made our dining experience so special was the knowledge, enthusiasm and levity that is so rare in highly rated restaurants these days. Michael treated my request for a glass of house zin like I had ordered a magnum of Bordeaux and when it came to dessert...he talked us out of a more expensive glass of port to try Passito di Pantelleria, to share with our strudel and panna cotta. WOW is the understatement and I just received 4 bottles  from a vendor in SF to surprise my wife and dinner guests next Christmas.

So Michael, this is really a thank you to YOU for making a dinner into a memory neither of us will forget. You have to respect a restaurateur who, when he could not talk Linda into having fresh vanilla ice cream with her strudel, replies, "great, now there is more for me."

We can't wait to return because in a City filled with great restaurants, this one also has a heart, a soul and a great sense of humor.
author: John B.

description:
Having been to Croatia several times, I was looking for dishes on the menu that would be more reminiscent of the great cuisine I've enjoyed there, but perhaps I need to make another trip back to try other dishes.

Nevertheless, the food was very good.  The arugula salad apples, mushrooms and prosciutto and the white truffle vinaigrette was tasty enough to be a main dish (you have a choice of the small or large serving size).  

The Strudel con pasta fatta in casa (a pasta casserole with proscuitto and cheese - topped with a tomato bechamel sauce) was delicious.  But the risotto with mushrooms was just okay.

The service was rather slow but pleasant overall.  

The ambiance is intimate - we had an engagement proposal going on right next to us (a birthday party group).  Thank goodness she accepted so that we could finally move on to sing happy birthday.

Had a lovely experience there.
author: Mic D.

description:
Food was good, but the service was pretty slow. We got there an hour and a half before a comedy show we were trying to make down the street and we almost didn't make it. 

The waiter was very knowledgeable about wine and the food was good. I would return, but not if I had to be some where after.
author: Carmen C.

description:
My BF found this place when he was on the way to TJ's.  It looks like a cute place so we decided to visit this place when his parents were in town.  It turns out to be a great pick!  The chef and owner of the restaurant, Bruno, is such a character!  He told us that Albona is the only Istrian restaurant on the West Coast.  He told us some interesting stories and taught us how to make the tomato soup without adding any cream!  I had the tomato soup and it was creamy (without cream) and delicious!  

Everyone loved their dishes - veal, rabbit and lamb dishes.  My BF's father mentioned that he loved the veal dish, but he would go for the lamb dish instead.  Bruno must have overheard our conversation and he gave my BF's father the veal dish as a gift.  So we had 5 entres to share amount the 4 of us.  I really like this little restaurant and the wonderful service that we received.  We will have to go back soon!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan as well! 

So this tiny place that is in between houses and a few building away from bright light is actually quite wonderful! I'd never thought I would  find a place like this unless it's word of mouth marketing or yelp. Pricing was phenomenal and food could be compared to Thomas Keller's fine dining. 

What we had:

Fried Gnocchi - YUMMY!!!!!!

Rich - Had the Seafood Linguini ---- HE MADE A REALLY GOOD CHOICE!!! If i knew him well enough, I'd steal his dinner and have him eat mine.

Neel - Had the Veal ---- Another awesome choice with the help of me convincing him to get it : I ate half of his dinner cuz I think I know him well enough to do that=P

ME: I had the strudel ---- This was good...too rich for my tasting, so I needed variation...Thank God for a party of 3!=)

I' would definately go again....heck if the michelin guy would, why wouldn't I?
author: Irene L.

description:
very small--looks like it used to be a house converted to a resturant.
the servers look like bad models....keep pushing us to order some stuff we don't want....
the food was WOW nor amazing...so average

our server recoommended robbit, told me people say it's one of the best robbit....i am so sorry fluffy robbit..i shouldn't trusted the wolf.

it was dry and over seasoned....i don't think i will ever go back. 

plus where is the owner? the servers actually "complained" in front of the customers saying "oh the owner on'y does his owner thing, doesn't come here..." 
HEY! if you have problem with your employer, talk to him. don't complain to us...?
author: Sisi W.

description: My husband and I went here for dinner last night for my birthday and it was great! I loved every moment of it! Our server was so attentive and sweet, the ambiance was very intimate and romantice and the food was delicious. We hope to be back there soon again!
author: Hoda F.

description: Very disappointed with this restaurant.  Waiters were rude and obnoxious.  The appetizers were actually decent.  The stuffed calamari and gnocci was good.  But my proscuitto risotto was dry and so salty.  Dessert of panna cotta was just plain.  Did I mention the rude waiters?  No excuse for bad service.  One star for the appetizers and friendly valet.
author: Grace L.

description: Following the amazing reviews on Yelp, my wife and I checked this place out being in town visiting. We were not disappointed! The freshly made soup and ravioli was one of the best meals we had on our trip. Next time I'm in SF, I'm definitely going back.
author: Marc R.

description: I found on Yelp (Thank you) - I agree the food is 5 stars, I had the sardines for the apps - yummy if you like sardines (don't picture the can kind, picture the filet kind), the owner was so kind to give the history of Albona, He secured my valuables in his office, how sweet. The bus boy (man) held the door open for the ladies room, (wierd but kind).  Very home feel to it.    I give it 4 stars ONLY because we were at a table for four and it was a little squished. There was a slight delay on my entree but I think it was more my fault, "I'll take the sea bass, no wait, I'll take the strudel"  - Order both!  The wine reco was perfecto!  I would go back.
author: Eva H.

description:
It's a hidden gem from the busy fisherman's wharf, just a few blocks away and very close to the cable car stop. 

It's been a place to earn Michelin recommendation for consecutive 3 years and received a score of 100 for its cleanness. It must not be easy and there are good reasons for all of these. 

Impressed by their menu written in Istrian and the cozy inside decorations, we decided to try their insalatina mista, Strudel con pasta fatta in casa and risoto de speck con zaferan. The salad was simple but you could tell the high quality of veggies used. My risoto was full of prosciutto and saffron flavor. I cooked ristoto and definitely appreciated the efforts and time making a good risoto. The pasta looked filling on the menu but it actually wasn't! It's light, tasteful and also very special. 

Based on the owner's recommendation, we ordered the a delectable gelato mousse and the panna cotta. Both were great!!! The panna cotta was very soft and full of Mascarpone cheese flavor. The gelato was similar to iced expresso coffee. It's hard to choose which one was our most favorite. 

The service, including the waiter, owner, busboy was so friendly. If I happened to have friends in town and would have to go to fisherman's wharf, albona would be a unique and comfortable place for dining instead of those along the wharf.
author: Ile F.

description:
I picked this restaurant against my better judgemet. I decided to go with some of the yelpers that said the restaurant was good. I would have to say that it was a little disappointing. 

My biggest problem was that were rushed through dinner because they had another table coming in at 8:45pm which didn't leave us much time to relax and enjoy our dinner. 

The food was ok. I had the veal shank and pollenta. It was a little salty and not very hot. I was unimpressed. I tried some of my husbands pork with saurkraut and that wa much better than what I was eating. Dessert was better but not stellar. I had a chocolate torta. It was a little bitter and room temperature. It's supposed to be cold. 

As for the decor, it was mediocre. It looked like they built a restaurant in someone's living room. The bathroom was small as well and the so was our seating space. I kept getting brushed by the waitstaff. 

I am being generous with my rating because Bruno(the owner) was a delight. He was sweet and funny. He is quite the character. But if you want my recommendation try to settle for a group less than 5.  You'll be fine. I might come here again.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Not much I can say that the other 5-star reviewers haven't said here already....come hear to eat well, sample authentic cuisine from a very special region, and learn about the food and the area from a very special individual - Bruno.  You won't be disappointed!

Bravo Bruno!  Lei e stupendo!
author: Sharon F.

description:
I will start this review by admitting that I don't anything about Istrian food.  Therefore, this review doesn't mention authenticity or bringing me back to memories of summer Italian travels.  Instead, I'll talk about general flavors and presentation.  

We ordered only one appetizer, the peperonata (mix of veggies in olive oil).  While the flavors were good (not too salty, not overly seasoned), the small serving of veggies was definitely not worth $9.

For the main course, we had 4 different entrees: penne a la "arrabbiata", braised veal shank with soft polenta, stuffed pork loin, and the halibut special.  The meat in the dishes were overall well cooked and pretty flavorful.  I think the pork loin was a little bit dry, but the veal was tender and the halibut was moist.  Unfortunately, the sides and sauces were lacking.  On a few dishes, the sauces had formed a dry crust on top and you definately had to break through the dried top layer of the soft bland polenta.  The penne was just barely warm on top and couldn't melt the pre-grated parmasean that was sprinkled on top.  The veggie side that came with the halibut was also kind of odd... just steamed and arranged on a little plate (literally, some in rows). 

Service, though polite, was slow and incorrectly timed (as demonstrated by the dry sauces/polenta and luke-warm penne).  This could have been excused if we'd been eating during a busy time, but we were there for the 1st seating (5pm) and only two other tables had customers.
author: Iris Y.

description: I came here recently with my husband and two friends. We split the granda salad, peporanata, and the pan-fried gnocchi to start. They were all amazing! The gnocchi is unlike any gnocchi I've ever had...lightly fried, spiced with cumin, and covered in a savory gravy-like sauce. Delicious. Then I had the seafood linguine, which was also very tasty. We ended with the dark chocolate flan for dessert...rich, creamy and not overly sweet. The service was excellent. Everything was timed out perfectly and the waitstaff were very nice and professional. The dining room was also very quiet and calm, which was soothing after a long workday. The only issue for me is the location....it's sort of on the outskirts of North Beach...almost Fisherman's Wharf, and we're rarely in that area.
author: Jenny R.

description:
I went to Albona after reading SF Yelper reviews...this Chicagoan wanted to check out what you recommended before making my destination restaurant choices.

Well Yelpers, thanks for steering me to Albona.  Absolutely some of the most tasty food I have ever experienced.  Tremendously fresh flavors and craft displayed in dish preparations.  I was blown away by the perfection.  From gnocchi, to their special casserole veryone mentioned, salmon, and risotto....all were popping with flavor and  textures.

Nice intimate dining area.  Casual dress welcomed and the approach by service staff is attentive/friendly.  As an "out of towner" on a SF long weekend visit, I am so glad I made this restaurant a destination.  No attitude either with my using the Restaurant.com coupon by the staff..  Highly recommended by this Chicagoan...and we know food!
author: Dawn A.

description: I took my girlfriend to Albona to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday.  We had a fantastic 5 course meal that beat expectations all around.  The restaurant has a nice, small, personal vibe, and the owner and head chef are very nice and walk around and meet and greet all of the customers.  We had the asparagus soup, fig and prosciutto, potato gnocchi, strudel con pasta fatta in casa, lamb shank, and home made desert.  We could have eaten a couple more plates of the potato gnocchi, but all of it was amazing.  I will definitely recommend this restaurant to friends.
author: Joey F.

description: Food was great, service spot on, perhaps feeling a little rushed, otherwise awesome all around.
author: Geoff M.

description: 4 1/2 star rating is well-derserved.  Food is excellent, service was quite good, and the atmosphere was that of a local, homey spot.  The gnocchi were unigue and delightful.  The 3-cheese raviolis were terrific, but the gem was the Strudel con pasta fatta in casa.  Not the average Italian bill of fare, which made it all the more terrific.  Definitely merits a return.
author: James S.

description: I love this restaurant very much.  This time we brought friends and they were very pleased.  The staff are so polite and took great care of all of us.  Throughout the evening I noticed mike (the owner?) shake every person's hand that preceded to leave, every single person.  Eddie the server has a watchful eye and is super accommodating.  This restaurant has the best arrabiata in San Francisco and the mash potatoes are close to prefect.  I could eat here every night.
author: Noel J.

description: Old world regional Italian cuisine...fantastic. Do yourself a favor and get the rabbit...you'll thank me later. Super friendly and great service.
author: Scott M.

description: This place is a hidden gem.  As usual, yelp came through in helping us plan a last minute dinner reservation in San Francisco.  The restaurant is a little off the beaten path, and if you weren't looking for it, you could easily walk right past it.  We made reservations, were seated quickly and had a great dinner.  We all enjoyed something different for dinner, and I had the pork loin stuffed with sauerkraut with a side of red cabbage.  It was incredible.  Others at the table enjoyed lamb chops, fruite de mare, stuffed pasta and lots of other great stuff.  I have read other reviews from people that ate some of the same things and didn't enjoy them.  My only thought is that the chef must have had a bad night.  Not one complaint from anyone in our party of 6, and we all consider ourselves to be foodies of varying degrees.  Great meal, great experience and great staff.  They only serve beer and wine, and the wine list isn't huge, but we were able to find a bottle that we all enjoyed none-the-less.  Check the place out for sure!
author: Corey O.

description: This place is just great.  The food is superb; I had the best Panna Cotta ever for desert.
author: Bill B.

description:
Here's what I loved:

Parking
- Free and friendly valet (when I hand over my keys I want to trust the person I'm giving them to)

Service
-truly excellent service by professionals
-the waiters are personable without being too chummy
-each table is served by all waiters (I love that)
-service is FAST, the dining room is small so there's little chance that the waiter will get waylaid by another table and forget your request on the way to the kitchen

Food
-the rolls were very good, hot, buttery
-everything we ordered was really quite good
-the sauces were flavorful, rich and reflected the mixed Italian and Eastern European influences of Albona
-possibly the best tiramisu I've had: light, moist (but not wet), delicious 

Here's what could be improved:

Food
-the rolls were great (see above) but the bread could have been better (or skipped, just bring me more rolls, please!)
-vegetables on the menu as sides, there weren't any
-vegetables on my plate, there weren't any (I actually changed my order when I saw my selected dish arrive at the neighboring table because it was served with veggies that looked like an afterthought and a disappointment)

Decor
-the dining room is small and it wouldn't take much to turn things up a notch
-the lighting could be improved to create better ambiance and intimacy
author: Sarah K.

description: I had a fantastic time at this place last night.  It's great for a date or a family dinner.  Last night, my father remarked that he felt like he had drifted to Italy because of the decor.  I asked if they had lemonade and, to my surprise, the waiter whipped some up in the back even though it wasn't on the menu.  An extra star for that!
author: Candice P.

description: We had another good dinner at Albona!  The ravioli with fried sage sauce was outstanding.  Risotto with seafood was good though not wonderful, as was the fried gnocchi.  Caramelized pears with gorgonzola were terrific.  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because the service was at times lackadaisical - had to ask twice for more bread and more water.  But the owner didn't seem to be there that night, so maybe that is why.   Albona is still  quiet, low-key, and delicious and highly recommended.
author: Mary S.

description: So so good!! I had the Strudel con pasta fatta in casa and it was amazing!! Yum!  Our waiter was very nice and when we ordered dessert wine, he put it on the house!! Great experience!!
author: Courtenay D.

description:
Okay, so overall, this place was good. Not bad, or decent, or amazing, but good. The location was a bit strange and in the middle of nowhere, a residential area. The restaurant itself was a bit cramped, but cozy and well organized. I didn't enjoy how the waiters had to keep asking my family and I to push our chairs in. After all, we are the customers. The service was good, too. The waiter was funny, and the meal didnt take too long to come to our table. The food itself was good, not amazing, but good. I expected a bit better. The chicken was moist, the sauerkraut stuffed lamb was very good, especially the side of beets, but the rest of the meal wasn't too impressive either. Surprisingly, my favorite part of the meal were the rolls and butter, they were soft, ha ha. I don't think I would come back, but it was a pretty good one time experience. 
(side note: the price per person was a bit too expensive based on how the food tasted etc.)
(side note: it kind of threw me off how they kicked us out because we were sitting there chatting after)
(side note: they ran out of a dish so we had to re order...)
author: Katie K.

description:
it was amazing to me to find an italian restaurant in north beach that was not on the cheesy strip. this place is heads and shoulders above its painted sisters in terms of the quality of its food.

i had the pasta (can't remember the name but there were thick noodles and peas) which was divine. my husband had the rabbit which was cooked to perfection on a delicious bed of polenta.

the restaurant is tiny (less than a dozen tables) and quiet. would recommend reservations, and making use of their valet service if the thought of finding parking in north beach scares you.
author: T. B.

description: Excellent sardine appetizer and linguine with seafood.  Ok coffee gelato.  Not so great Croatian wine (what did I expect?).  I would have liked bigger portion because I was really hungy, but I have to say that the food was quite tasty
author: Tim M.

description: This is definitely the first restaurant in the US that I have visited which has Istrian cuisine.  Think northeast Italy, going into Croatia, Slovenia, and Austria.  Very tasty, family-run, does attract an older local crowd, but the whole thing is done with love and care.  A wonderful dining experience, not only because of the tasty food but the service from the always-present owner who does put a lot into this place to make it what it is...
author: Todd S.

description:
A delightful restaurant!!! Since my family is Croatian (from the Istrian coast), it's very rare to find my own ethnic cuisine anywhere, so I was delighted to find an Istrian restaurant. With the waiter's help, I had an authentic Istrian meal: 
1) Mushroom soup (oh my God it was good!)
2) Venetian sardines-fresh fish butterflied with a sweet sour sauce, very flavorful. Flavor reminiscent of caviar.
3) Seafood Stew-with shrimp, mussels, calamari and other seafood--easily the best I've ever had, with triangles of grilled but not soggy polenta. Oh my, that was delicious!
4) Chocolate sorbet for my birthday dessert. Very chocolatey and very flavorful.

You can order pasta, but I wouldn't, since that's more Italian cuisine than Croatian. This is very fresh seafood with a twist and I will certainly go back again! The place is very small and very popular, full even on a Thursday night, so make reservations. But do try it! Don't limit yourself to the pork or the lamb (although I had a taste of my husband's serving and it was great).
author: Elisabeth M.

description: Don't miss this gem.  We were welcomed the minute we walked into the dining room. They made you feel that you were part of their family and they would assure you that you would have a wonderful dining experience.  We were not  disappointed with attentive service and excellent food.  Sam, the chef and owner, took our order via memory and the food was delicious.  This is not a tourist spot as many of the Fisherman's Warf restaurants have become. This is a fantastic neighborhood restaurant just off the main Fisherman's Warf area.
author: Robert A.

description: We got lucky by finding this restaurant.  We had plans to see Beach Blanket Babylon and needed a restaurant to eat at beforehand. Thank goodness for the internet. We found Albona and had an outstanding meal with exceptional service.  This is a hidden gem.  We had one vegan at the table (me) and I had a super meal that they made for me.  Everyone else had rack of lamb and other dishes that were out of this world.  Stop reading and call to make a reservation.  You won't be dissapointed. Thank you Albona for a fabulous night in San Francisco.
author: Wendy T.

description: Little hidden secret in SF. Place has seating for 20 people tops - food is made to order and absolutely delicious. Service is relaxed and stress free. Calm environment. A unique experience.
author: Gator N.

description: You know what makes this place amazing...the service. Really outstanding. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We dined here at about 8:30 and we were four women. The staff called a cab for us and made sure that our cab came in a timely manner by calling the company every few minutes. How sweet it that? On to the food...it was delicious. Asparagus soup is a must, the Penne pasta was to die for and the veal shank was out of this world. The chocolate flan is the best thing you'll have in the world. Its a great place in the middle of a residential area. So its all locals really...just go! Trust me!
author: Lisa A.

description:
Our first impression with Albona Ristorante Istriano was good, intimate neighborhood gem with valet service and friendly waiters. Right away they took our coats and gave us a nice welcome.
The food on the other hand was not up to the $400. (6 in party). We don't mind paying good money for a nice meal, but was disappointing.
Stuffed pork tenderloin (highly recommended by waiter) was dry,tasteless and appeared to be precooked and reheated. Lamb loin was also seemed to be precooked and overly spiced for our tast, both these dishes could be cooked to order in the time it took to be served.
The fish stew was good, but the was filled with (cheaper) calimari ($29).
After reading reviews on Yelp, I'm assuming we came on a night that the chef was off!
It's a good thing we spent the rest of the evening at BeachBlanketBabalon!
To be fair $400 included 2 $40 bottles of wine and 3 deserts, but we only had salad and entree courses.
On a Saturday night I would expect better!
author: Chris P.

description: I recently went back to Albona on New Years Eve and found out that Mike no longer owns the restaurant. Without his presence, the restaurant is very different. The New Years Eve menu was a little weak, but the service was good. Just no "home" feeling any more. I didn't feel like I did when Mike was there. I probably won't be back, unless it's to visit Eddie (one of the servers) whom I love!
author: Tanya H.

description:
Forget reading all of the reviews.  This is the best Italian restaurant on the planet, well... at least in San Francisco!!

Thanks to our server, Michael Bruno, who just happens to own the restaurant after growing up in it, we had an unbelievable experience and great food.  Prepared from his grandmother's recipes, we loved the gnocchi (completely unique), the mushroom risotto, and the strudel (look for the pictures).  Thank you, Michael for your hospitality and recommendations.  (My wife thinks you're cute) Boston is a long way away, but we WILL be back!!
author: Neal S.

description: This is the most unique Italian food I have ever experienced. The owner is sweet and very knowledgeable. The restaurant produces a cozy, homey feel.
author: Kim H.

description:
went here last night with the bf and had a wonderful experience. the place was pretty chill, only a few other tables so we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves. 

service was excellent - our waiter was super knowledgeable and recommended a great wine. he was funny in kind of a sarcastic way - not the cheesy overdone waiter personality you usually get in such an established venue. turned out he was michael bruno, the nephew of the original owner... we liked him even more knowing that he still waits tables in his own place. 

the food was amazing and unique - bf got the sauerkraut soup which he loved, i got the strudel which was so rich and incredibly tasty. salad and calamari app were also good. for dessert we had raspberry sorbet, which was delicous (tasted like fresh raspberries, not sugary sweet, just like it was made with really good fruit). also got the biscotti which you could taste was homemade and not from a stale costco box. 

the best part was our bill only came to $98... for two apps, two entrees, two desserts and a bottle of wine? def will be coming back here, a neighborhood gem to be sure.
author: jaja w.

description: Excellent food! Excellent service! I and my hubby had a great time here. We ordered all vegetarian entrees and it was amazing. The service was especially exceptional. Highly recommended. Oh, btw, free valet was awesome too!
author: Shikha C.

description:
Fantastico. I came here with my girlfriend and her cousin while she was in town. We had two appetizers, two glasses of wine, main courses, two desserts, as well as a bottle of sparkling wine. It came to $150. Add a tip, and it came to $190 for three people for a three course meal with wines. 

The decor is nice, the restaurant is a little small although I did not feel intruded upon by other diners at any time. The menu is small, and apparently varies somewhat frequently. It was a very pleasant experience, with frequent attention but never overbearing, although it did take the waiter quite a while to ask how our meals were after receiving the dishes(luckily for him they were great).

I would definitely come here again for a special occasion. I don't think I'd come alone. Overall, one of the best restaurants I've eaten at, and I would expect the minor faults to be acceptable at this price range. 

Now, for the menu items we had:

Appetizers: 

-Sardele in saor a la Veneziana - fillets of fried sardines with glazed onions. Very good and light, with a fresh seafood taste. Sweet onions and raisins offset the vinegar marinade nicely. The fish itself was a little dry.

-Tomatoes in reduced balsamic - An offf-menu special that was basically beefsteak tomato slices in a reduced balsamic sauce, which was slightly sweet. Nice and refreshing, and was nice beside the sardines. A little simple, but delightful.

Main Courses (which I sampled):

Costolette de aniel - Mustard and herb crusted lamb, with potato and eggplant and pesto napoleon. The lamb was perfectly cooked, with the crust adding good crunch against the soft meat. There was a bit more fat on the lamb than I find ideal, leaving me with a forkful of fat no matter how I sliced it in the end. Despite being simple in appearance, the potato and eggplant side had all the flavor of lovingly roasted home cooked vegetables. This was my entree. 

Paired with:  Petite Sirah - EOS '06 Reserve - (Paso Robles, CA). I'm afraid I'm not a wine connoisseur, but this was a nice dry red wine, with some berry flavor I think, and it complimented the meal nicely. 

Penne a la "arrabbiata" - Tomatoes in spicy garlic butter and basil sauce over penne. I only had a small sample of this dish. The penne was dangerously close to being undercooked, and the sauce was a bit strong. To be fair, I was tasting it after the fatty lamb, so I probably got an unpleasant blast of acid flavor comparatively. My girlfriend, who had the dish, enjoyed it.

Peto de polo a la Maraska - chicken breast in brandied Marasaka cherry sauce served with herb risotto. Again, I only had a mouthful of this dish. The chicken was moist, cooked perfectly, and the sauce had nice sweetness. The risotto was cooked perfectly, and to quote Iron Chef, "It's like someone opened my mouth and stuffed a fistful of herbs in it." A burst of surprising flavor, along with a perfect texture. 

Dessert: 

Bonet - Amaretto flan. A delicious flan. Nothing else need be said.

Crema de gelato - Triple cream gelato mousse with Marasaka cherries. I had this, despite the fact I know I don't like gelato or mousse. The cherries were delicious, and the gelato was good as well, with a nice coffee flavor. 

Wine: MOSCATO d'ASTI - (Piemonte) - Michele Chiarlo, Nivole '06. A nice sparkling moscato wine, light and citrusy. Went well against the sweet chocolate desserts.
author: Paul H.

description: Excellent!  Bruno opened this restaurant years ago.  Michael, his nephew, recently took over operation.  After you are seated Michael generally goes over the menu making suggestions.  The menu highlights items which are local and fresh.  The food is delicious, wonderful flavors.  Presentations are beautiful.  "Grandma's Gnocchi" is a must.  Service is first class. Modest wine list which compliments the food.  This is one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco and we visit ever chance we can.  You feel and are treated like family and feel like family.  Prices are extremely reasonable.  We feel this restaurant is a hidden treasure and seriously underrated.  You will enjoy the experience.
author: Dick G.

description: After reading all the glowing reviews about this restaurant, I had to try it.  I decided to take my bf here for his birthday, and made 7:30 reservations for  Saturday night.  We were promptly seated by the owner who was extremely nice.  The food was excellent and the atmosphere was unpretentious.  I would highly recommend this place for a romantic date night.
author: Paula R.

description: Smaller-sized restaurant.. I think they only take reservations.. The outside is very deceiving because it's a plain white front with part of the name hidden by a tree on a quiet neighborhood, but inside is very elegant.. It turned out that I was even served by Michael Bruno himself! I had their special winter soup and salmon steak.. the soup was thick and yummy and the salmon was amaaazing. I will definitely go here again.
author: Amelia B.

description:
This place used to be one of our favorites. The host provides truly excellent service. He welcomed us despite our casual clothing when we spontaneously decided to check out Albona after a day spent wandering around SF. Unfortunately, some of the servers have attitude that detracts from the tone he sets.

Food is interesting, Northern Italian fare, but is loaded with salt. The texture of their signature gnocchi is the best we've had, but the last time we went, we had a veal shank that must have come from an aging cow. The connective tissue overwhelmed. 

In general, the plating is beautiful, and the sauces showcase the hours of reduction that goes into them. Well-worth going, especially if you're tired of spaghetti and meatballs.
author: Simone E.

description: Just an amazing evening!  We chose to celebrate my birthday here Friday evening (all the way from San Diego) based on Yelp and TripAdvisor reviews.  What a wonderful experience from the moment we arrived.  We were immediately served 2 glasses of champagne with a Happy Birthday greeting.  The restaurant is small, cozy and romantic and we had fabulous service the whole evening.  Sam, the owner, came out to our table and offered to help us choose a white wine, since they have some very unusual varieties that we are not familar with.  He opened one from Slovenia (my Grandfather's birthplace) for us to try, which we didn't care for...no problem, he opened another from Croatia that we really enjoyed.  We started with a wonderful appetizer to share and they served incredible rolls that I swear are homemade.  My husband had chicken in the yummiest sauce I've ever tasted.  I ordered the fish of the day, a halibut that melted in your mouth.  They offered us the dessert menu, but we declined.  A few minutes later, they served us a complimentary gelato with a birthday candle.  Throughout the evening, you could see Sam all over the dining room, greeting people, helping with food service, refilling wine glasses.  We were so well taken care of, without the service being obtrusive.  Our only regret is that we didn't eat here the 1st night so we could have gone back a second time.  They were very busy and all of the tables were full, so definitely make a reservation.  We can't wait to go back to San Francisco so we can make another visit to this wonderful restaurant.
author: Linda G.

description:
Very good food and service in a slightly upscale neighboorhood atmosphere.

I will definetly revisit on a future trip to SF.  Good experience; good value.
author: bob c.

description:
Ate here last night for the 2nd night for a special, celebration dinner & the food was excellent like my first visit. Need to remember to come here more often or when friends are in town for a nice dinner.

Had the potato gnocchi for appetizer & they were great...crispy on the outside with a nice, thick possibly-beef-based sauce. For entree had the tender lamb noissettes w/steamed veggies & roasted potatoes.

Friendly, knowledgable staff. Our waiter was very helpful in our dinner selections & saved my dining partner from ordering something too rich/creamy, which he was avoiding.

Definitely will eat here again (& again). I think the menu changes seasonally.
author: D L.

description:
I absolutely love this place, every detail, every touch of decor was just supurb. The small flower arrangements, the candles, an overall understated elegance. 

From the delicious pasta (light and subtle, fresh herbs, nothing overpowering and heavy) to the dessert (a wonderful fluffy Tiramisu, again, with every ingredient perfectly complimenting each other) definitely left me wanting for more. 

Our subtly humorous waiter just added that touch of Italian wholesomeness, the experience here was just...absolutely wonderful.
author: Shane S.

description: My husband and I treated our out of town guests to a lovely dinner at this fabulous restaurant.   We discovered this gem via its positive Zagat ratings and loved it.  The food had a unique european flare that was refreshing and absolutely delicious.  I highly recommend the rack of lamb.  Perfect temperature, texture, and flavor.  The chef personally came out and shared the menu with us and even offered to do something custom for my husband who has a limited diet.  We will definitely be dining here again in the near future.
author: Michelle C.

description: Not bad. Foods alright. I wish I ordered the Lamb instead of a pasta though. I could see why people like it. Its quiet, cozy, and the staff is nice. Probably wouldn't take friends or a date here but I would definitely take my grandma.
author: Christian H.

description: Small quaint little restaurant on the outskirt or North Beach. They have free valet parking. I went with a party of 6 and we made a reservation ahead of time which I recommend because it is a small restaurant. We all like to share food so we ordered several dishes and ate family style. We had two salads: one with arugala, apples, prosciutto in a white truffle vinaigrette. This one was good but the truffle oil was a little overpowering for my taste. The second one had figs and fontina cheese. This one was so delicious. We ordered the pan fried gnocchi appetizer which everyone seemed to really like. We had mushroom risotto which was prepared perfectly. We had the strudel pasta rolled with prosciutto in a tomato cream sauce. We had the ravioli stuffed with raisins, pinenuts, cheese and nutmeg. This was one of my favorite things. I could have eaten a whole plate to myself easily. We also oreder a rabbit dish. I couldnt bring myself to try the rabbit but I tried the sauce it was cooked in and it was yummy. Everyone else really like this dish. We also had the salmon special which was good. I read the reviews on yelp before we went and saw that a few people said the tirimisu was dry. We ordered it and it was not dry at all. It was actually some of the best I have had. We also had the panna cotta and the gelato. All of the desserts were excellent.
author: Melanie V.

description: I had high expectations for this restaurant after reading all the glowing reviews.  I agree that the service was great and would give it a 5, but the food for both me and my husband was probably a 3 1/2.   We had the mushroom risotto, calamari, sardines and veal. The food was just okay; not amazing.  I don't think we'll be going back, but do appreciate the good service.
author: Sheila B.

description:
Five stars easy! I would never expect to find such a unique restaurant, especially in the redundant North Beach neighborhood.  Although this place has an Italian flair, do not be mistaken, it's actually Istrian!  It's heavily influenced by the Italy because of the large population of Italians there, but it's located in Croatia.  As a result, the cuisine is like nothing else around.  I would describe it as a mix of Italian, German and Eastern European cooking.  I got the grilled eggplant with melted cheese and it was soooo rich and delicious.  For my entree, I got the pork loin and the combination of flavors from the meat, sauerkraut and cooked fruits was lovely.  My only complaint was that the meat was a little dry.  If I get to go again I will try either one of the seafood or red meat dishes.  The sauteed red cabbage that came with my entree tasted more like beets, so if you don't like beets, beware. For dessert, I had the chocolate torte, which was creamy and chocolaty, as promised.  

Albona is a family owned restaurant and they don't just own it, they run it too.  Bruno, the head honcho, entertains the guests, fills your water glass, and develops a relationship with every table.  The main server is his nephew who is also friendly, funny and welcoming.  

This restaurant is not large or modern.  It's cozy and has a European country feel, which makes for a rather relaxed feel.  Even though you will not feel the slightest bit of pretension or fancy-shmancy stress, I wouldn't come here in sneakers and a sweat-shirt.  Bruno and fam want you to feel special, and indeed, being here is a special occasion, treat it as such.

With such personal and warm service, great food and even free valet, you really can't go wrong!
author: Aristocles P.

description: A very small but nice find. Reservations for larger groups not a problem. The service is five star.  It's small. Complimentary valet at dinner   Menu is a little limited and food was a little bland but never the less a nice whole in the hall. Only beer and wine
author: Sarita d.

description: This is a great spot.  Very close to the Wharf and walking distance from the hotels.  A small place so a reservation is a must I am sure.  Excellent food and great service.
author: Shaun N.

description: Cute, quaint and unassuming restaurant. Looks like you walked into a family's home dining room. Great service. The manager that night was very inviting and active on the floor. Had an amazing seafood linguine I've been dying to go back for. Great date/anniversary restaurant.
author: Brendan W.

description:
It's with a heavy heart that I give Albona 3 stars, but my second visit, just last week, was a disappointment ; (  My first visit was a magical weekend night where warm Bruno, the proprietor/chef, spiced up the experience with quality time telling stories of Istria's history and national identity. The food was excellent and interesting, and the wine went down easy. I left beaming.

As for the second outing, a Wednesday night: There are a few things I demand in a restaurant, and steamy, hot food is one of them. Kudos for the warm bread rolls, though I would have preferred something crustier. The potato gnocchi in a brown gravy flavored with bits of beef were served almost too quickly, and merely warm, but not piping, a real shame since these conditions made the potato croquettes seems gummy and overly salted. It made me believe that the unusual dumplings had been quickly reheated on the stove and whisked to the table.Not to be finicky, but I would have rather waited the extra 5 minutes for food hot enough to convince me some Nonna had shaped them just for me.

Salt was an issue, it turns out. The beef shank over soft polenta was good, though I again wished the meat had been hotter. The polenta was hot and delicious, though halfway through my meal the predominant taste in my mouth was salt. Thankfully the red wine cut through some of the sodium-- had it really been this saliferous before? Suddenly I didn't feel it was worth the $75 for two price tag anymore.

I'll try Albona one more time, but it'll have to be a night when Bruno's around. He may just well be the restaurant's secret ingredient, the one without which Albona would just be another over-esteemed North Beach dining room.
author: Jessica D.

description: We went there for my birthday dinner and it was absolutely perfect.  We were looking for something different than what we normally have, and after reading the reviews, we decided on Albona.  We definitely made the right choice.  Everyone was super friendly and helpful with the menu.  They also gave us a dessert on them, which was unexpected and such a nice touch.  When back in town, we will definitely eat here again.
author: A S.

description: My husband took me there once with my in-laws (they know the owner). I loved the ambiance and I was in Italy. I loved the food and the service was excellent  ! The rack of lamb is juicy !
author: Debora D.

description: One of my new favorites. Homey and unpretentious, and great food. I had veal with rosemary sauce, and it was a very tender beef on the bone. Service is amazing- not ingratiating but also present when you need it. This is actually the kind of restaurant I've been looking for in SF for about 12 years. Great for a date, for the parents, for you and a buddy to really talk. Get a reservation, or drop in and get on the list and go to Fior d'Italia for a drink (great bar).
author: Anna B.

description: Ate here last night for the first time - outstanding.  Sam, the executive chef, was warm and inviting, and the food was culturally interesting - a mix of Italian, Hungarian, and Austrian.  The porc involtin stuffing was out of this world -
author: Helene L.

description:
Over-priced and not very tasty.  Strange plate compositions i.e. dry pork loin stuffed with plums and sauerkraut.

 4.5 stars?? seems like there may be some ballot stuffing

There are hundreds of restaurants with better food and ambiance at this price range in SF, I would not go back.
author: C L.

description:
I use yelp all the time as a resource but have never took the time to give back. Well here I am world... My first yelp review. This little Italian eatery is cool. Small and quaint. We had to wait for our table, although we were right on time for our 830pm reservation. The people before us didn't want to leave. yak yak yak. Humans like to talk. The wait staff was cool and asked if we wanted a glass a wine while we waited. We ordered a bottle because we weren't driving, and we like to drink wine.
The wait person had an Italian accent and was very nice. Italians in Italy are pretty cold, especially in Rome, so we were happy that our server was so cool, kind and happy. But its not really about the service when I go out, it's the food. My wife and I had two different pasta dishes and they were good, not fantastic out of this world good but good. I had the three cheese ravioli and my wife had a lasagna dish, it was better than mine.
We also shared two appetizers which were also good, not great. The asparagus with kalamata olives and shaved parmesan was one and the pan-fried potato gnocchi in brown sirloin sauce. I was hoping the pan-fried potato gnocchi was going to blow may taste buds away into another world but it didn't happen.
I don't know if I need to come back here but I think I will give it another try in search of pasta nirvana. If you are looking for a good Italian dinner in S.F. you will want to keep this place on your short list.
author: Bruce R.

description: Still/again my favorite SF restaurant! I hate to review Albona because it's hard enough already to get a table--but now they're open 7 nights a week... More good news: they've ditched the Bad Maitre D', so once again I can take all my friends & visitors, confident they'll love the gracious, friendly ambiance as well as the diverse, yummy Istrian cuisine. Istria = a stubby peninsula SE of Trieste, once controlled by Venice, so Albona = Italian meets Austro-Hungarian, with trade-route spices, plus SF freshness.
author: Charisse H.

description:
considering my husband is from istra and even he loves this restaurant; 5 stars.  bruno is wonderful.  the decor is wonderful, think grandparents living room.  the food is comforting and the experience one to write home about.  i just wish he could get the real wild asparagus because once you try it, you never forget it.

side note, the first time i went to croatia i asked for everything without salt, i am now used to it and love it, but yes, they do love their salt, as most europeans do...
author: Jane J.

description: My favorite Italian in the city.  I always order the ravioli in butter with sage.  Ugh!  So good.  The ravioli get a sweet little crisp to them from the sauce.  And the service is phenomenal.
author: Danielle B.

description: Excellent. They were nice enough to squeeze 5 of us in before the dinner rush without a reservation. What a dining experience! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We had the stinko de videl a la Triestina (veal shank), Involtin de porco con capuza garbi e prosuto (pork loin), peto de polo a la maraska (chicken), and the strudel con pasta fatta in casa (pasta). He started us with some bread and tomato soup. The breads were amazing and my mom (a tomato soup lover) said it was the best she'd ever had. Even my brother who is a picky eater tried everyone's meals and liked them. Everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned with the best mix of flavors to leave your palate craving more. For dessert we had the crema de gelato, bonet, and strudel which after such a fabulous meal exceeded expectations once again. My brother said it best, out of 5 stars, this place deserves a 10! Will definitely be back after Tuesday when they are revamping their wine list!! Can't wait!
author: Natalie W.

description:
My fella and I chose this place for our anniversary meal. We ran a little late for our reservation and were even edging close to closing time. They were very gracious. Our waiter happened also to be the owner of the place, and he started us off with two glasses of champagne, compliments, to help us celebrate. Small place.  I almost felt like I was in someone's home dining room set up for a family wedding. The owner (young fella! Good luck!) brought me a sip of each of the two wines he thought might compliment my meal, which I always like.

The food was astonishing. We started with the gnocchi, which were more like tater tots -- light and airy, with a crisp exterior. Great texture and flavor. Shane had pork (with Bacon? I can't remember-- we were there in May) which he thoroughly enjoyed, and I had the rabbit with juniper berries, which was tender AND chewy, sweet and savory, complex and earthy. It had good sauce! The juniper was a perfect accompaniment. I might say this was the best main dish I've ever enjoyed, and I've been around. We had dessert, and like the rest of the food, it was light, and rich, and genius. The frozen coffee mousse (not normally something I would try) was the ideal meal ender-- it had some kind of to-die-for soaked cherries on top. The creme brulee was unique as well-- light and satisfying.  We walked out feeling very happy. Perfect amount of food, and I'm still remembering it rather vividly two months later.
author: Jenny H.

description: Bruno rocks!  I was the only one on time for dinner and was sitting by my lonesome self for a good 30 minutes but it didn't matter b/c Bruno took care of me like a guest.  I was offered water, wine, bread, and reading material on Trieste!  Definitely an out of the ordinary North Beach dining experience in this hidden gem and a menu unlike any other you'll find in North Beach.  Felt like a huge family dinner in a dining room.
author: Debbie Y.

description: The food is great. It is VERY unfortunate that the service is HORRIBLE! My reservation was at 8:30 & didn't get seating until after 9 pm. There was no hostess. The waiter kept forgetting my name and my party & asked 3 different times what was our party's name was under. The waiter offered free soup to other tables that were waiting long, but not ours. Took over 45 mins for us to get our entrees and we ONLY ordered entrees. Our waiter NEVER checked up on us. Our bread basket, butter, and water were empty and we had to asked for more. ADDITIONALLY, they got my order wrong & had to wait another 20 mins for my entree to come out. I will, forever, never go back to restaurant. They deserve a negative star. The food doesn't make up for the service. For such a classy restaurant, I expected MUCH more especially since it has 4+ stars on Yelp. This, by far, is one of my worst life time experiences at a nice restaurant. I recommend going to Acquerello, Spork, Commis, Chez Panisse, Wood Tavern, EOS, Cassis or Roy's. These restaurants are consistent with their service.
author: Shelley L.

description:
We have eaten at Albona 10 to 12 times.  We live in Marin and regularly make the trek to the city when friends come to town to enjoy the food and feeling of the restaurant.  The restaurant is small and because of that people who want distance from other diners may not enjoy Albona as much as we do.  

This time I enjoyed the ravoli.  I tend to get something different every time.  Last time I got the Gnocchi and loved it.  Their braised veal shank is excellent.  We took some friends a couple of weeks ago and their 7 year old ate his "first rabbit" and loved it.  

The wines are reasonable.
author: Bryce L.

description:
So Perfect! A great find for delicious unassuming food.  Small intimate setting in a low key location.  

My husband and i were staying in the city for a little get-a-way and wanted a good night of good food.  We found this on yelp and decided to try it out.  I love italian food and this place did not disappoint. The bread basket came with 2 kinds of bread.  A sourdough and a soft roll(my personal favorite) that are great on there own but even better for soaking up all of the delicious sauces from the various dishes. We ordered the pan fried gnocchi.  Amazing!  Then for the dinner we both ordered the strudel con pasta fatta in casa, a fresh pasta roll stuffed with prosciutto and cheeses, then baked in a casserole that's breaded and topped with tomatoes. Served in a creamy tomato sauce.     
I love to cook and i wish I had the recipes for both dishes.  A little note, this is not a "hat wearing" kind of restaurant.  We felt a little under dressed in our hats, jeans and converse. The very nice host offered to take our coats and hats for us was our first clue.
author: Lisa D.

description: Excellent!  Great service! The lamb, venison, and veal shank were awesome.  Nice atmosphere and what a nice pace to have a slow, enjoyable dinner.
author: Michael Z.

description: This is the kind of restaurant we should all be happy to have in San Francisco, not just because the food is very good but because you're supporting someone's labor of love. We came here on a quiet midweek night in mid-Jan with my 12-year-old daughter promising best behavior.  The host/owner was more than gracious, offering to customize anything on the menu to her taste.  The server topped up my first glass of wine after bringing my husband a second one - so thoughtful. Food was very good, not mind-blowing but worth the price.  Panna cotta was excellent!  Highly recommend and would return.  Note: no more free valet parking but the server was again diligent in calling us a return cab.
author: Kathy A.

description: one of the best meals i've had in SF.  really cozy and intimate restaurant with personalized service and great food.  will definitely go back again!
author: Ching-Mei C.

description: Change is good here! This is not typical Italian food... Why that when you can have something interesting, Istrian, and new?! I've been a handful of times, and my most recent trip the other weekend was by far the best. New owner Michael Bruno, taking over from his Uncle, continues to set the bar high for his unique cuisine, terrific personal service, and warm atmosphere. Growing up and now working in an independent family business, I enjoy supporting the same elsewhere. It's a wonderful place to bring a date with its small, intimate setting and the valet parking is a nice touch. First visit must haves include the pan fried gnocchi in a sirloin sauce and pasta strudel. Impress your friends and family with this special restaurant just far enough away from tourist central. You won't be disappointed.
author: Bryan C.

description: Ridiculously good Italian food with impeccable service.  Everything was so amazing it's hard to pinpoint favorites, but the stuffed calamari was fantastic.  The marinara it was served in was hand-down the best I've ever had.
author: Andrew G.

description: at first we were miffed that the place has such long wait times. but oh my god it was so worth it. the food was amazing and the staff was fantastic. a small place that gives an air of homeliness. the rabbit is highly reccommended (if they have it, its not always available) and the place is apparently coveted by the locals. excellent place.
author: ben f.

description: Mushroom risotto was fantastic.
author: V R.

description: 3 stars. one word = meh. perhaps it was bc i was using a coupon, or it was raining, but somehow all the components did not mesh together well. the brightest spot was the arugula salad. i found the panna cotta dessert especially underwhelming...i could've made a more delicious version at home!
author: Suana W.

description: Bruno is a character! He helped us select our entrees and was very knowledgable with his wines. The meat and fish dishes were so tasty and rich in flavor. The special cheese caserole and calamari are unreal! The decor is simple yet cozy.
author: A D.

description:
Bruno would swing by and talked about a number of topics: while he was out at the Farmers Market that morning with his wife buying berries for the made-in-house desserts, or my girlfriend's outfit and how his wife (who is no longer spending days at the business) would love it, and or how healthy sour kraut is for me and how glad he was that I'm a sour kraut kinda guy, or how men are typically slobs not so concerned with fashion.  
  It was really nice.  The interior is pretty nondescript, which had me guessing the food was going to be pretty good.  I was right.
It was great.  Brandied anything is always perfect on any dessert.
Pork loin stuffed with prosciutto, sauerkraut, caramelized onions = cha-ching with their by-the-glass Zin.
  Bruno's nephew was working there also.  Support your local family business.  Plus, this place will reward you with a very satiating/ pleasant night out.
  Also - they take reservations via - open-table.com.  This is becoming a plus for me again.
author: RiCH K.

description: Thank goodness for Yelp and yelp reviewers otherwise my fiance would have never found this place to take me to. We went here for dinner before we went to see Wicked. The service was great, place is small (13 tables, I counted) but the food was delicious. We tried the calamari, fried gnocchi, strudel, and the seafood linguini. I didn't try the seafood linguini but my fiance said it was one of the best he's had. Word of the wise, do not ask for cheese on your seafood linguini because Michael would not allow it. As of right now, we have no idea who Michael is but guessing he's the owner? The waiter would not put any cheese on the linguini which was probably a good idea because Michael does not allow it here. Ok, you guys are the boss! You know best.
author: Karin C.

description: Cozy little neighborhood place, perfect for a special occasion. Love the food, love the people!
author: lucas b.

description: My husband and I booked a reservation on opentable.com and were excited to eat here since it had a pretty high Zagat rating.  We started off with the asparagus salad which was pretty good and then had the stuffed calamari, which was tasty.  However, both of our entrees missed the mark.  I had the seafood stew, which had very little flavor and was mostly calamari with 2 wedges of polenta (which I hoped would be creamy, but was more on the hard side).  My husband had the ravioli which was a "bit tough" as he put it.  I was really disappointed and hoped we would have a better experience. We won't be back.  There are just too many great restaurants in S.F. to settle for so-so food.
author: E P.

description: We always love visiting Albona. You'll feel right at home the second you walk in and the food is incredible! Our favorites always include the rabbit, cherry chicken and risottos, but everything is amazing. A favorite restaurant that we always look forward to! Special thanks to the wonderful staff who make everything perfect from free valet parking to ensuring your meal is perfect!
author: Marni G.

description: I don't normally write a review, but after reading the review from Robert T. Los Altos, CA insincere guy I had to write a review.  I was just there with my husband two Saturdays ago and I have to tell you this guy doesn't even know what he is talking about.  I have been going here for the past 10 years and I have NEVER had a problem.  This is a very mellow restaurant that makes the dining experience super cozy.  It is true that you see a lot of older, mature diners but that should be a good sign, right?  It means that the flavor of the food is consistent and doesn't change.  The only problem I have is that I'm so full when I leave.  This last time we went, we had the asparagus soup was very light and flavorful.  The Insalatina mista was simple but tasty.   We then had the Granzo a la tartara freddo - my husband's weakness. I then had the Strudel con pasta fatta in casa and it was out of this world.  IT WAS AMAZING!  Every time I tell people what I had at Albona, I actually smile just reminiscing the incredible delicious taste it left in my mouth ; ), that's when you know it's good.   My husband had the Linguine con granzo e pesse, salsa de pomodoro fresco e aio and he really liked it.  But again, our love was for the strudel.  We tried 3 different desserts, the crema de gelato, the raspberry sorbet and the Panna cotta.  I recommend the crema de gelato to those who like espresso and because the cherries soaked in brandy are delish.  The Panna Cotta is enough reason to want to come just for that.  Our server who's name is Jesus was very pleasant and attentive to our needs.  One of the owners made a point to come and speak to us to make ensure that everything was good.  We got to talk to the other owner, who is the Chef and his wife and both are very down to earth.  As you can see by the majority of the reviews given to this restaurant, this guy Robert T doesn't know what he's talking about.  He is a rude, condescending, ignorant man!  If you have never been here, you should try it out.  If your previous experience wasn't deserving of a 5 star, I would recommend trying it again.  You will not be disappointed this time, I guarantee it!
author: Anny F.

description: Food was excellent aside from tad too much cumin in the gnocchi.  Servers were extremely knowledgeable but stretched a little thin.  Highly recommend.
author: Matthew T.

description: This restaurant is very small with only about 10 tables in the restaurant. Again, I made reservation and was greeted with a smile. The owner is from Italy and knew the key to customer service. He learned everyone's name in the restaurant and occassionaly came by our table and asked "Bella, how is the food?". Very impressive.. I ordered rabbit which was amazing and the wine that was selected was a great choice with the rabbit.
author: Bella I.

description: This is a hidden little gem.  It's cursed with kind of a crappy location and the decor isn't great, but the menu amd the owner's (Bruno) passion for food is outstanding.  We wanted a whole bunch of dishes and Bruno indulged us with plating out the appetizers on small dishes for us.  Do not miss his calamari with "homestyle" marinara or the fried gnocchi.  The veal "stinco" was unreal as was the lamb and the strudel con pasta fatta in casa, which tasted like a sweet pasta version of a delicious ham sandwich (sounds weird - but it was great).  Be warned, Bruno gets in your face at your table, which is fun and endearing to some, intrusive to others.
author: Max C.

description: My husband and I went here for our anniversary.  It was a small restaurant but very warm, especially the owner.  We ordered the risotto and the veal shank.  These dishes were to die for.  They split all the dishes for us and even the soup.  If only we live in SF, we would probably go here all the time.
author: Anna S.

description: Great! Make a reservation as the dining room is tight. I wanted to try everything on the menu, so will just have to return. The service is really wonderful too.
author: Candace A.

description:
i think this restaurant is good, but a little overrated.  it's a nice, unassuming atmosphere, but the food isn't really so amazing that you have to go again.  plus, the portion sizes are a little on the small size.  That being said though, it's still worth trying.  Just keep in mind about the portion size and tamper your expectations

Appetizers - potato gnocchi - actually outstanding and the best part of the meal, though there were only 8 gnocchi in total; calamari was average, and there were only 4 pieces!

Entree - I tried the seafood risotto, and it was above average.  It wasn't too heavy, and there was white fish interspersed throughout.  it also came with a few mussels and shrimp
author: Robyn F.

description: Valentines Day! Man it was hard to get reservations even three weeks in advance. Tried Harris, Ruth Chris, The House, Gary Danko etc... nothing for my time slot. So finally I get reservations here at Albona. Valentines Day saved. Their prix fixe menu was pretty good. The entrees' looked really good on the menu and wished we could've ordered more than one item. The wifey chose the Mushroom soup, The eggplant appetizer and for the main course she had the Ravioli in white sauce. I had the prosciutto mixed greens, Stuffed Calamari and the braised Veal. The wait staff and the valet folks were extra nice. Pretty pleased so far then they started us off with a fried Gnocchi which was a nice touch with some bread. I almost sent it back to say we didn't order this, but my devilish side said hell eat it, it's here already. The salad was ok but I loved the mushroom soup and my braised veal with rosemary served with polenta. The polenta was alright, if I were to combine this great veal with some creamy mash and sauteed' broccolini it would have really made this dish great. It just lacked greens but the Veal was the high light for me. Wife didn't have enough room for the ravioli. We capped off the evening with some dessert as she had the Chocolate Flan and I had the Gelato and both were excellent they even brought out some champagne infused chocolate truffles that resembled either giant dried prunes or rocks you'd throw into a lake. Looks are deceiving, they were quite good. These guys really emphasized service but our food came out a little slow but hey it was valentine's day and I get it...it's about building the romance and ambiance so they hit a triple at that at bat. I would go back and explore the rest of the menu. Warning...if you go here bring the cash you're gonna need it
author: graham c.

description: It is all but a paradox that one of the few (authentic) Italian restaurants left in North Beach is, well... not quite Italian.  Tucked away in a rather improbable location a few steps away from Washington Square, the restaurant is named after the owner's hometown, a small town in Istria (i.e. Croatia).  The Venetian, Austrian, Balcanic and Mittleuropean influences all find their place in the menu and the dishes are faithful to the culinary tradition.  Cozy, comfortable room + amicable service + rather unique menu and wine list = great experience.
author: Matteo F.

description: We missed the infamous Bruno on the night we dined here, but the service at this cozy, intimate restaurant serving Istrian food was personal and unpretentious (as evidenced by the offer to split three-ways the English Pea soup and Deep Fried Gnocchi appetizers).  The appetizers were unique and delicious--the Pea Soup lacked the smokey, ham flavor you expect from Split Pea soup-- but I found the Brodeto I ordered (Adriatic fish stew) to be incredibly salty and not what I expected based on the description.  However, my dining partners enjoyed the breaised veal shank and strudel.  And the homemade crema of gelato with brandied cherries is not to be missed.  Great for a casual, comfortable dinner and a taste of non-traditional Italian food.
author: Vivien W.

description: Don't like to give out 5 stars but hard to find something bad about this place.  Have been here many times since Bruno started the place something like 18 years ago and have never been disappointed. On Francisco street,  tucked away from the maddening crowds of North Beach.  Even the parking is easy, free valet in North Beach!!  Prices are fair for SF.  If you buy one of his wines he will cork yours for free,  I feel this is very fair.  The food is excellent  European style cuisine (just read any of the numerous below reviews many are spot on).    As one of my guests said during a recent visit, "It isn't a meal it is a memory".  Look this isn't the French Laundry but for an honest European style meal and a family run business I give it 5 stars.  BTW, you can book the restaurant for small groups or meetings, just ask Bruno about the details.  I did it once and it worked out well.
author: Damon S.

description: this is an excellent restaurant, and not your run of the mill italian joint. There are some tried and true things on the menu, but most things on the menu I have never really seen before on a menu of an italian restaurant. I.e dishes with SAURKRAUT? say what..say word! Loved it. everything was amazing, and somehow the guy remembered my dad and greeted him like they were old friends ,names and all.
author: Lauren V.

description: One of the best restaurants I've ever tried!  Everyone, from the hostess to the owner to the chef, was so welcoming and helpful.  I had some friends in from France and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us - splitting up all of our dishes so we could sample everything, taking us to the kitchen to meet the cook, and even after the hostess had cut her finger and was on her way to the hospital, she stopped by to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.  I highly recommend this cute little place for any meal!
author: Maya G.

description:
Food is great and authentic! Just a little heavy and it needs some good wine to wash it down.

I love the service and the owner is really friendly.

The only reason why I'm giving it only 4 stars is because they never renew their menu or at least never introduce any new special. I have been there 4 times now and they always have the same roasted fish. Everything from the menu is great (even though the menu is limited), but I would love some variety since I have been there often enough  to try pretty much everything.
author: Velvet F.

description: We had a calamari appetizer.  I had the lamb shank and she had the seafood linguine for the main course.    We had tiramisu and cappuccino for dessert.  The food was excellent.  Calamari was the weak point, and it was still good, especially because of the great sauce.  The sauce over the lamb was really, really good, but the sauce over the seafood was just OK.  The seafood dish was still very good, but I thought the sauce was just a little weak.  Almost bland.   I'm not sure it brought out the flavor of the sparse amount of non-calamari seafood on the dish.   My partner liked the seafood dish better than I did. Still, I think the chefs in this place know what they are doing. Service was excellent.  Prices were a bit high, but acceptable with the restaurant.com certificate.
author: Jack J.

description: The food here is amazing! I love the intimate atmosphere.  I came here with my whole family for Christmas eve and new years eve- it was perfect! I've also gone several times with out of town guests. The staff is always supper attentive and wonderful.  And the food is always perfectly cooked and so tasty!
author: Rose V.

description: a little out of the way, but simply amazing slavic-italian (i believe)! cozy and good service too.
author: Cass M.

description: My husband and I were visiting SF from out of town (though we used to live here), and we found this gem on Yelp.  Lucky us!  The food was fabulous.  We had the gnocchi appetizer, the mista salad, the strudel pasta, the mushroom risotto, the apple strudel dessert and the tiramisu. (Yeah, that was a lot of food.  But everything was so good that we just kept wanting to try more of the menu.)  - Everything we tasted was fantastic.  And we absolutely loved the atmosphere.  It is a small restaurant on a quiet street - you have to be looking for it to find it - and there is an intimate and friendly feeling about the place.  The owner/chef personally greets each guest and answers questions about the menu with patience and very helpful detail.   And service was plenty quick, but we didn't feel the least bit rushed.  It felt more like we were welcomed in as friends.  This was a romantic dinner out for us, and we were able to relax and enjoy our evening.   We absolutely loved our meal and the whole experience.  I can't wait to get back to SF so that we can come again.
author: Loree H.

description:
I am one of the lucky ones, as I live near this little hidden restaurant.  Even back in the days when Bruno still roamed the restaurant and almost sat in your lap to explain the specials Michael, now the owner, was the one who always impressed me.  I returned last night with a work colleague and as usual had a great meal.  

The fried Gnocci is a must have and was fantastic, the Veal Shank with the creamy polenta is probably the best I have ever had.  

The wine list is small but with good variety and reasonable prices.  We had a nice glass of Prosecco to start and a great Amarone with our meal.

And to finish the meal the Bonet (espresso chocolate flan) is an evil concoction that will likely add some additional lbs to my waist in the near future.

It is great to be able to support a small business where you like the owner and you get value for the money.  I highly recommend a visit
author: Brad G.

description:
When i first read the reviews of this place, i was put off by the mention of sauerkraut and german sounding food.  But it is very similiar to Italian food with a few different spices.

This is a very low key place but the highlight here is definitely Bruno, the owner.  He is entertaining, great with kids and has a great sense of humor.  We brought a group of eight here including several children and it was the perfect.  

Keep in mind that this is not a fancy, upscale place.  It reminds me of my grandmother's living room but it was perfect for our guests who probably would not have felt comfortable in a fancy restaurant.   And the food is good enough to impress your foodie friends.  This is definitely an unknown gem of North Beach.
author: Christine V.

description: The menu doesn't change that much, but these are all family dishes. There's love that goes into these meals. You know, it's what Lydia is always going on about. That's why eating at Albona always seems like you're dining in someone's living room. Well, that and the attention you get from Bruno.
author: Mark M.

description: Love this restaurant!  We live in the area so parking wasn't a problem-- we walked!  (but they do have free valet!)  We had to wait a little for our table but the host was very kind and apologetic.  It's a small dining room, but once seated, we felt like family there-- ambience is cozy and classy, without attitude.  Service is friendly and attentive.  The food is excellent.  I highly recommend Albona!
author: Tina C.

description:
Would give it a solid 4 1/2 stars.  Four stars for the food, which was solid, but not spectacular.  Went with the wifey and Sis-in-law who is an italian fan so decided to try this out, not knowing it was actually Istrian (which I've never even heard of).  We listened to some of the reviews and had the fried gnocchi, which was good and we enjoyed it, and also tried the eggplant pizzette which was also nice.  For the entrees we had a seafood risotto (with no cream, which my wife enjoyed) that was stuffed with seafood, and was too much for her.  I ordered the Lamb which was good, but most would consider a smaller portion, and the SIL had some pasta dish, which don't really remember but she enjoyed.  Again, I wouldn't talk anyone out of coming here, but don't think it'll crack my "must return" list.  
      On the other hand though, the service was great.  The host was very friendly and came around and talked a little.  The food came out at a decent speed, and were never left without water.  Also, there is free valet parking which is a very nice touch.
author: RJ T.

description: Excellent seasonal menu, and a cozy spot to dine.
author: Scott F.

description:
I had my first experience at Albona this past Saturday after I spent the entire day taking engagement photos with my fiancee.  I brought a couple of friends with me and we sat in the center of the restaurant.  Overall, the ambiance is quite nice, not too noisy, not too quiet, but well balanced.  It's a pretty small restaurant, so it's easy to feel cozy and removed from the busier parts of North Beach/Fisherman's Wharf.

Having recently eaten at Chinoise on Main in Los Angeles, where the famous Wolfgang Puck (it's his second LA restaurant after Spago) dropped by our table to thank us for eating at his restaurant (I was shocked to meet him for the first time since I assumed he was too busy, and famous, to greet fellow patrons eating there), you can imagine how pleasantly surprised I was to have Sammy, the owner of Albona, drop by our table to greet us!  We told him our engagement was the reason for celebration and he immediately provided us with complimentary champagne for me and my guests.  Sammy also took the time to explain to us the menu and his opinions on the different dishes.  I think we ended up ordering over a dozen or so dishes (apps, entrees, dessets) for five people and I have to say that I was impressed with the food there.  If you're willing to try new and different dishes, I think you will be pleased to find that there are several options to enjoy creative dishes.    Here are a several I tried:

1.  Chifeleti - Delicious and unique.  If you haven't tried pan-friend potato gnocchi, you should try this homemade dish that's made from scratch. 
2.  Insalata di Asparaghi - I'm not a huge salad fan, but I enjoyed this dish.  It's fairly simple and straightforward.
3.  Lamb Chops - Delicious.  I like my meats cooked rare in general, but had this dish cooked medium-rare and the flavor was quite nice.  The napoleon was excellent and complimented the dish well.
4. Sorbet - Homemade and delicious.  
5. Creme del Gelato - Homemade and excellent

We ordered a couple of bottles of wine to go along with our food.  I remember Chianti Classico was one of them but I forgot the other.  Once we received our desserts, Sammy came out again and spoiled us with some complimentary port to finish off our fantastic dinner experience.  

In conclusion, the food AND the service was outstanding.  I can't stress enough how intimate the restaurant is and the care and attention the owner has given to this restaurant.  And to add one last bonus, I was told by the owner that they provide FREE valet parking to customers...unfortunately, I don't have a car so I won't be taking advantage of perhaps the only restaurant in the area that provides this service.
author: Popojo R.

description: The food was great, but the service was excellent.  I'd give the food 4 stars, but I'm giving Albona 5 stars because of the amazing service.  Its a pretty small place with maybe a dozen tables.  The atmosphere is very cozy.  I had an arugala salad with prosciutto and sliced apples, and a filet mignon.  Everything was very tasty and the steak was cooked perfectly.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: brendan i.

description: The sardines are especially excellent.  Free valet parking.
author: Philip A.

description: Food was decent.  The diver scallops were on the small side.  Overall, all of the dishes were a bit too salty for our tastes.  Owner was very nice and made us feel at home.  Would give this place closer to four stars, but in the end, i was not a fan because of the saltiness of the food.
author: Liver B.

description:
Yes, it's pretty entertaining to eat here, but let's talk about the food.
