The gnocchi disappeared in seconds, the taste of the rabbit  made me forget about my beloved childhood pet, and the ravioli with sage butter sauce took me straight to my happy place .  A treasure.
author: M J.

description: thank you Yelp reviewers for turning us on to this fabulous little gem of a restaurant!  We searched for an Italian restaurant in North Beach to be near a show we were going to later.  I just wish we could have spent longer there.  I had a fig salad with goat cheese and walnuts in a red wine reduction dressing that was wonderful...never tasted anything like it.  My husband had their tomato soup which he said was the best he had ever had.  We were sitting next to this older couple and the gentleman kept talking about how he'd been coming to this restaurant for years and how everything on the menu was wonderful and he knew the family that runs it.  He ordered us a small portion of the strudel which was to die for!  I had the veal shank with polenta which was great.  My husband had their rib eye which literally melted in his mouth.  They are also known for their rabbit dish which I would get if I ever get the opportunity to go again.  It's a very small cozy place; great service.  Don't miss it!
author: Dianne C.

description: I love this place, can't say enough good things about it. The wait staff is always friendly and welcoming and the food is excellent.
author: Will B.

description: Albona is as good as it gets.   It is a real authentic italian restaurant with a diverse menu.  The highlights from the menu include just about everything on it, however the veal shank and the juniper berry glazed rabbit deserve special mention.    Beyond the quality of the dishes , Albona does an incredible job of making you feel welcomed and at home. If you enjoyed being treated well and incredible food I recommend giving albona a go!
author: Max M.

description:
This is the BEST experience we've had since grandpas took us to Tadich Grill a zillion years ago (and we still love it). My husband is a 'foodie' and we both loved Albona - as did our family and friends. 

The food is exquisite, and a bargain for the quality and satisfaction. The small space (it's easy to pass by) is intimate and chic, and simple. A few steps up to the tiny bathroom reminds you you're in the city in an old place - valet parking is a godsend. Staff are responsive, kept our glasses topped off, were knowledgeable, and never pushy. Mike is a delight, and gives great advice when asked. (These are his family recipes, and he knows them well.) 

The food reminds us of our trip to Europe/Slovenia - where the influence of Italy, Austria and Slavic traditions make what we call fusion here. We particularly loved the reduction sauces, and how each dish was unique and savory. We've gone twice, with over a dozen dishes tried, and recommend the Alamos Malbec 2007 - a fabulous red at a great price. 

This place is a treasure. If your hungry group can't decide where to go, try this - it satisfies the Italian urge, the Austrian/German urge, and the gourmand will leave thinking you've chosen brilliantly. Everyone is happy.
author: Laura B.

description: Impeccable food and service.  The pan fried gnocchi, strudel, and braised rabbit are all must haves!  My husband enjoyed the venison medallions as well.  I would definitely go back.  The Croatian red wine was quite nice.
author: Kimberly W.

description: Albona Ristorante Istriano is a small, quaint and extremely comfortable restaurant.  The food is absolutely wonderful, and the staff are extremely attentive and personable.  I celebrated my birthday with 7 friends and it will remain as one of my best celebrations.  This is a truly wonderful restaurant that I hope to visit the next time I am in town.
author: Shaun-Adrian C.

description: Albona is a gem in SF.  I've been there a number of times and every time the food is divine and the service is personalized. Every risotto dish on the menu is delicious, the braised rabbit and the broiled lamb are fantastic. For appetizers, I've had the gnocchi and the eggplant, both of which I loved. The ambiance is refreshing: a no-frill, no tourist atmosphere in the heart of North Beach. I highly recommend this place. It feels like an European vacation!
author: natasha d.

description: For all the generic Italian restaurants in North Beach- this place really stands out. Probably because it is not traditional Italian- its menu is influenced by more Mediterranean cuisines, so you have amazing dishes that you can't find anywhere else in the city. Definitely try the calamari and potato gnocchi's as appetizers- unreal! My entree was the prosciutto strudel pasta, and it was BY FAR the most delicious entree I've ever ordered any Italian restaurant in the city. The servings sizes for their main courses aren't very big, so don't be afraid to try a lot of appetizers. I'll definitely be coming back here.
author: J.C. H.

description: I would give Albona 7 stars if I could! What an absolute treat! Looking for a great Italian restaurant, I referred to my favorite site, YELP! The owner, Michael Bruno, was able to seat the 3 of us even though we did not have a reservation (we arrived before 6pm). We dined in a very intimate atmosphere and were treated royally. We started our meal with Michael's grandmothers' speciality: pan fried potato gnocchi in brown sirloin sauce. Divine! We cleaned the plate of remaining sauce with our bread! My husband, Brad, savored the braised rabbit with polenta. All he could say was "wonderful"! My son, Dane, had the Adriatic stew of fish. The sauce was delicate enabling the uniqueness of each fish flavor on the palate. Awesome! I had the pasta strudel that was rich and creamy. I cleaned my plate! We ordered a bottle of wine from Croatia which was heavenly. The wine was so versatile that it accompanied all of our dishes well. For dessert, Dane and I shared the apple strudel with vanilla ice cream; Brad enjoyed the 20 year old tawny port. We will be back!
author: Beth N.

description: Don't be fooled by the fact that this was the only restaurant on a street surrounded by homes and offices. The food was fantastic, service excellent. We had the Sturdel con Pasta and Rack of Lamb. Needless to say, we could have licked the plates, the food was that tasty. Prices were more than reasonable. Highly recommend.
author: Randy L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city.  Quality food and service.  Traditional food with a unique flavor twist that surprises you.  Try the grandmother's gnocchi app.  Keep in mind the place is really small so you'll be pretty packed in there but it's totally worth it.
author: Miss A.

description: I came to Albona for a family dinner celebrating my grandfathers birthday. When we arrived, we had to wait even though we made a reservation. I had other plans for the evening, so this was not good for me at all. However, throughout my experience I was reminded by the teachings of Bruno that sometimes you have to wait for something good. Bruno was one of those people who helps to put perspective into your life, what is really important. Family. Food. The little things all around you. Enjoy them, enjoy the Istrian cuisine of Albona.
author: Max R.

description: This is a great place to bring your wife or a date. It's intimate and the ambiance is nice. Service was quite good. The owner was very friendly and came to our table several times that night and spoke with us. The menu is great. I got the braised rabbit and was fantastic. The portion was just right. Highly recommend coming to this place if you already haven't.
author: Mike B.

description: I have never experienced such rudeness in my entire life.  I came here about a year ago with my honey and another couple.  At the time, I was vegan - not because I don't love butter and cheese, but because I thought it might help me with some health issues.  The other couple chose the restaurant and made the reservations.  I looked at their menu online and saw that they didn't have any vegan dishes.  Knowing that they were excited about the place and not wanting to be rude, I ate dinner beforehand and was just planning on tagging along.  The owner came over to our table to take our orders.  When he got to me, I said - oh I'm not eating.  He asked why and I told him that I was vegan and had already eaten.  He looked at me, completely seriously not even joking, and said - well then why are you here then?  That turned out to be only the beginning of unbelievable rudeness all night.    I believe the tip that night was a nasty note on the bill.  This is one of only a few places that I can honestly say I will never step foot in again.
author: Squirrel L.

description: Since there were so many hype about this restaurant, I had really high expectations.  Unfortunately, my experience here was was only mediocre at best. First, the restaurant is very small, so you must have reservation to get in.  Once seated, I felt very claustrophobic, since the table next to us were only a few inches away...there was not a lot of privacy.  Waiters were friendly, but service was a little slow.  While waiting for my food, I noticed that there were only 2 waiters and 1 waiter assistance doing everything at the restaurant... so they do work hard.  I ordered the seafood stew, which was good, came with a big bowl of seafood, little bit of sauce and polenta.  The portions were a good size.  My boyfriend ordered the seafood pasta but wasn't too impressed.  Overall, everything was ok., but not memorable. I don't think this is my type of restaurant, however, a lot of people seem to like it.
author: Eva E.

description: For food, service and ambiance, this is my favorite San Francisco restaurant. We have come here for our anniversary (corner table), with friends in groups of varying sizes and just the two of us when a nice walk from Embarcadero or Montgomery BART (35-40 minutes) will enable us to work up an appetite or savor our meal before heading back to the East Bay. The crowd here is a mix of a few tourists who happen to find it and locals who know a very good thing. While the food is Istrian (a peninsula SE of Venice and Trieste), you will recognize the ingredients and savor them in new and wonderful combinations. Rabbit, chicken, pork, always fresh fish and shellfish (mussels marinara in season), and pastas such as you don't find anywhere else (a savory strudel!). They make their rolls from scratch and serve them warm. The desserts here are wonderful and varied - do save room - fresh sorbets and gelati, a chocolate flan-like creation....Basically anything the chef or your server recommends will be wonderful. Free valet parking, too, if you can't find street parking.
author: Sara E.

description: I took a good friend here for his birthday in Fall 2009...and what a treat. It's a small intimate Italian restaurant away from the bustle of other North Beach restaurants. The food was excellent - the pan fried gnocchi was so unique and delicious, and we ordered the two fish (sea bass blue nose and salmon) specials, cooked to perfection in their respective tasty sauce. The only bit of downside was the arugula salad, which was good but needed a bit more dressing. But, the atmosphere and the other dishes more than made up for it. The owner, who served us, was delightful, charming and friendly. It's a perfect place for good friends and families, and even a date.
author: Nichola A.

description: Every time I come here I feel like I am going home.  The owners have a personal interest in their clients and make you feel like you are one of the family.  The food is top notch.  You will be dreaming of it for weeks to come....it is well worth the price. Also, it is off the beaten path so you don't feel like you are in trendy tourist S.F.  My parents make me take them here every single time they are in town too! We wish them all the best!  Go experience it for yourself!!!
author: Melissa B.

description: The food was great, closer to authentic northern Italian than most. We came with a screaming baby to this quiet and cosy restaurant, and the staff was extremely gracious in helping us deal with the situation. Service was excellent.
author: Nicholas N.

description: i have to agree with my gal's review here (michelle h). this place is really neat. the owner is a little over the top, but if you proceed to get a little sauced, he can be highly entertaining. his nephew is taking over eventually and i hope he keeps it going.
author: tommy p.

description: Really liked this place.  The food was unique and tasty (not typical italian), and the small size with quiet atmosphere makes it more appealing for a date.  Mike Bruno, the new owner and nephew of the former owner, works extremely hard and takes a lot of pride and care in making sure his customers have a great experience.   Even better, it is off the beaten path from the standard tourist traps like Stinking Rose, etc. in Northbeach that try to move people in and out faster than Baron Davis left town.  You really feel like there is a higher quality here, I recommend this place to anyone.
author: Glen E.

description: One of my very favorite restaurants in San Francisco! The owner Bruno is unbelievably charming. The food is truly amazing. Bruno tells you great stories and helps you pick just the right combination of dishes for a fabulous evening.
author: sara N.

description: Two of us dined at Albona and it was definitely a unique experience. Bruno is 70 years old. He has so much energy. He personally welcomed us at the door and continued giving each of his customers a very special welcome. We learned that albona region embodied croatian and venetian influences. The food and service was good but the good character of the owner and his place was the best memory.
author: Seymour S.

description: Nothing is bad, nothing is spectacular. More than what I would pay for the quality of food, but overall a decent experience. Service was fine.
author: Vyl C.

description: So i came to Albona with the tears still drying from a knock-down-drag-out-we're-breaking-up fight with my boyfriend. Irrelevant, some may say, but those generally make me nauseas and incredibly unfriendly, so really this review should have ten stars. I was out with the girls and we were extremely impressed by Albona's creativity when it comes to Italian. Little gnocchi bites, eggplant deliciousness, and a strudel made with Italian ingredients. Who would have thought German and Italian worked so well together? Except the Japanese I guess...anyways...the point is it was delicious. It was a perfect setting, really intimate like a New York ground level restaurant. Michael the owner was a very pleasant, attractive  host who I'd imagine gets more than his fair share of giggly girl tables, although he doesn't look like he's getting much sleep. This dinner succeeded in taking my mind off the mushroom cloud that had been my relationship for a full two hours which, in my world, is unheard of.
author: Katie T.

description: The lombo de agnel ai ferri (lamb) and strudel con pasta fatta in casa (prosciutto) were absolutely divine!  The owner is no longer Bruno, it's his nephew Michael but it seems Michael is keeping the restaurant running at a high level of deliciousness :)  Michael was very personable and we enjoyed talking to him.  He made sure to check to see how our dishes were and was open to a critique :)  The (free) valet service was much appreciated seeing as how the area is pretty impacted parking wise- do make reservations though because the dining room is cozy.  Overall was a superior evening, from the gnocchi appetizer to the coffee and creme brulee for desert.  Will definitely be going there again!
author: Bex B.

description: First time there.  Read about it here on Yelp.  Thank you to the previous reviewers for turning us onto this great little place.  Now owned and operated by a family member of Bruno (retired), named Michael.  Service was professional and courteous even with a full restaurant.  All of our dishes were phenomenal.  Bread was fresh and hot.  I asked for olive oil for dipping and they gave us a freakin' cereal bowl full!  A very flavorful oil too.  The fried gnocci and stuffed calamari were to die for.  The sauces were a delight!  The ravioli with sirloin meat sauce was an interesting diversion from the usual tomato base sauce.  And it was topped with bits of real sirloin...yum!  My veal shank came with a delicious (albeit salty) reduction sauce hinting of rich berries.  Prices were reasonable for this locals place hidden down a quiet (comparably) street.  Decor is a bit old school but you will quickly overlook this when the servers engage you and the plates start to arrive.  Michael, thank you for the great experience.  Keep up the great job!  We'll be back next time we're in the city.
author: Deric H.

description: This is a very cute restaurant and perfect if you are looking for something unique in North Beach. The service is friendly and it is an intimate place to take a date. The pasta strudel is delicious and very rich! The braised veal is wonderful as well! Definitely give this place a try!
author: Christi B.

description:
+
bruno, the owner,  the italian grandpa you never had.  he was a pleasure and took great care of us.

service: flexibility with reservations, complimentary valet, explanation of the menu, treated us like family 

salad, seafood stew

-
don't drink their suggested wine from trieste region

other dishes good but not outstanding
author: Henry F.

description: This place is amazing! The food is great as well as the service. I have Celiac Disease, so I can not eat Gluten so I  let the waiter know. He was very helpful and let the chef know immediately. We ordered the scallops as an appetizer, thinking that that would be a safe thing for me to eat and something the rest of the table agreed on. Almost a minute after putting in the order the waiter came back out to tell me that I could not eat the scallops as they were dusted in flour before being fried. I was grateful and disappointed at the same time. To my surprise when the waiter brought out the appetizers for the table he brought out a special anti-pasta plate for me, from the chef. Something I COULD eat, that was also delicious! I left happy, full and, best of all not sick! I will be back!
author: Christina C.

description: A great experience.  Attentive service from a well-trained staff that acts like they've been working together for years.  A chatty, pleasant owner who waited every table himself.  Unusual, remarkable dishes that we never could have expected but now can't stop talking about.  A pleasant, low-key atmosphere where diners are focused on their meals and dining companions instead of their surroundings.  And the corker: out the door for $120, starters, entrees, dessert, and a bottle of wine included.  Not what I'd spend every day, but for a meal like this I could get hit with twice as much and consider it a cost of doing business.  We will be back.
author: Bill T.

description: Absolutely wonderful, the most delicious dining experience with consistently excellent, warm, personal service!  It is always a pleasure to dine in this place.  Bruno (the owner) is very caring and warm, he comes over to every table to personally welcome everyone and describe every dish on menu in such detail that you can't wait to try it, and once you try it - it is exactly as delicious as he described.  Michael, the right hand of Bruno, has the most exceptional customer service skills.  Always attentive and very friendly.  I have dined in this restaurant many times and have never been disappointed.  This place truly deserves five stars for consistently great dining experience, delicious menu, and wonderful people who work there!
author: Lirrie L.

description: My nephew was in town from Seattle this week so my family took a drive in to the city to see him. Was I ever glad my husband made reservations at Albona! What a treasure! Michael greeted us like family and made us very comfortable. The food was tasty. No tourists, just locals (and my nephew).  I had the lamb w/a wonderful wine sauce. Hubby had the halibit which was delish. Dad had the fish stew (and I think he was the winner at our table). Nephew had the rissotto but claimed the rice was not all the way done. Superb on the wine, desserts and coffee. A+ on the atmosphere. This is not a place to take your young kids. It is a romantic, tiny gem.  We'll be back!
author: Wendy P.

description: What a hidden gem. Cozy, professional staff, warm and welcomeing although small. The food was great and definitely not "cookie cutter:. Can't wait to go back. the owmer Michael is definitely attentive.
author: lynn b.

description: Very welcoming, incredible service and a deliciously inventive menu.  I had high expectations after reading all the other reviews here and I was not disappointed.  I felt like we were guests in Michael's home.  He was very gracious and recommended a fantastic bottle of Montepulciano.  Not only is this off the beaten path geographically, it's also a nice journey away from traditional Italian fare.  We'll be back for sure.
author: Rob T.

description: Very small restaurant - great atmosphere.  The owner was very friendly and everyone went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. With the recommendation of the staff, I enjoyed one of the finest meals I have ever had.  The food was exceptional.  I had the most interesting pork and sauerkraut dish - fantastic!  If I ever get back to San Francisco, I will definitely return.
author: Laura C.

description: Came here after hitting the Exploratorium and Ferry Building with the hub and kiddoes. Went inside to make sure we were appropriately dressed (we weren't but it didnt matter because it was early - we've got little kids so we eat with the 65+ crowd). We were welcomed to stay if we were going to be gone in 1.5 hours since the places was booked for a party .. again we've got little kids 1.5 hours is about double the time we need so we sat, ordered and experienced some super tasty and delicious food. Ordered a great bottle of Riesling (I'm on a kick lately), had an appie, our entrees, kids shared some pasta and BAM we were out. The food was really delicious, well put together and not cookie cutter by any means. We will absolutely come back if we're ever in the 'hood again. Props to the dude for not giving us the "eew, you're not from the city are you" look and props to the waitstaff who treated us well !!! YUM!!!
author: Tofoi Y.

description: Hidden gem is right. Wonderful dining experience. Great food, exceptional service. You never know when a place has received so many good reviews if the people are just raving because perhaps they're friends of the owners...not the case. We went because of the good reviews here on yelp and were not disappointed in the least. Being foodies, being vegetarian - we were completely satisfied and accommodated. The gnocchi was crispy on the outside and light and fluffy inside, sprinkled with powdered sugar. WOW! Unusual and just right. The rest of the meal was just as spectacular and the staff, especially Michael, were so sincere and attentive. Every nuance impressed us: the way he avoided touching the rim of the wine glass with the wine bottle when he poured, the exchange of silverware between courses, the time he took to share some of the history of his family's business. We will definitely return. We feel lucky to have found this hidden gem.
author: Carrie S.
